data.title: The 50 best photo spots in Bengaluru

placeMetadata.name: Bengaluru Palace

sources.snippet: Built over a century ago in the Tudor-style of architecture that’s reminiscent of French and English castles, the Bangalore Palace is one of Bangalore’s most Instagrammed locales (you should check out our Instagram page here). The Maharaja’s courtyard downstairs is bright and vivid with a brilliantly colourful Azulejo tiled-bench and a fountain to go with it. We suggest coming in early, like just before the sun sets for the perfect Instagram moment as the suede works wonders on your skin.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots In The City

sources.snippet: There's nothing new to introduce about this Tudor-style architecture built in the 80s' which is also a reminiscence of French and English-style castles. If you are from Bangalore or travel to Bangalore, you will know the fame of Bangalore Palace as one of Bangalore's most Instagram worthy places. The major part of this monument is the Maharaja's courtyard that is vividly decorated with a tiled bench made in Azulejo style and a fountain.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: A grand relic of the Mysore King- British rule in Bangalore, the Bangalore palace was constructed in 1873, by the British guardians of the then-minor Mysore king Maharaja Chamarajendra Wadiyar 10. The castle style fortified towers, battlements and turrets and that lush cover of green foliage on the building's outer walls are sure to add a touch of European flavour to a photo shoot without ever leaving the city.
sources.shortName: Best Place For A Photo Shoot In Bangalore And Around (50+)

sources.snippet: The Bangalore Palace is one of the top venues in Karnataka for pre-wedding photographs, since it is imposing and stunning from every angle. The gardens are lovely, and the interiors are regal, making it a popular setting for pre-wedding photos in Bangalore. If a couple is serious to a pre-wedding photoshoot, they might spend a whole day visiting the Bangalore palace.

sources.snippet: For those who love architectural photography Bangalore Palace gives an insight into this royal past of the city. The palace's Tudor-style architecture,the sprawling grounds,and decorative interiors make it an engrossing subject.Photographers often capture this majestic structure against blue skies or while enjoying soft lighting during golden hours.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Bangalore Palace, situated in Malleshwaram just 3 km from the city center, is a majestic royal palace renowned for its stunning architecture and intricate carvings. With an entry fee of 260rs for Indians and 500rs for NRIs, this historical gem boasts 35 rooms and an open courtyard on the ground floor adorned with granite seats embellished with fluorescent blue ceramic tiles.
placeMetadata.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

reviews.reviewText: The Bengaluru Palace is a real palace where the kings of the  Wadior dynasty lived. It has an entry fee of ₹270 per head for Indian visitors. It has a huge collection of photographs of the last few kings and queens of the dynasty. They give a free audio guide - a device with headset to listen to the history in every spot of the palace. They have maintained very neatly. Photography and videography are prohibited. One can witness the photo collection, artefacts collection, paintings of significant painters like Raja Ravi varma. Immerse oneself into the rich history and culture of mysore kingdom. Outside the palace a neatly maintained garden is there. There one can click wonderful photos keeping the palace in the backdrop. The place is peaceful, surrounded by trees. Many families, couples, friends and tourists visit this palace daily. If you are in Bengaluru, this palace is a must visit place.

Famous attraction in Bangalore known for it's exterior grandeur and beautifully arranged lawns and gardens. The interior is not worthwhile,only some average courtyard and rooms of the royal family. Exterior is beautiful and well maintained. Entry fee is 270 rupees which is high.

Felt like I was walking inside an old royal house. The building looks grand from outside, good for photos. Inside, it’s quiet and old-style, with old furniture, paintings, and halls.

Ticket was rs 270, bit costly for what you see, but okay for a one-time visit. Best part was just sitting outside and enjoying the view.

Visited Bengaluru Palace today and had a good experience. The palace is truly majestic, and I especially loved the beautifully maintained garden – perfect for photography. The pleasant weather made the visit even more enjoyable. A must-visit place in Bangalore!

If you are new to Bangalore and want to have a local outing then it's a one time visit.The structure of palace is fascinating from outside.They charge 300/- for Indians and 500/- for foreigners and give an audio device to listen.Not that worth it as compared to Mysore palace so far the entry fee is concerned.Historical lovers would like this place. Cameras and photography are strictly prohibited inside the palace.

Just seeing and listening to the history felt the old king rules and lifestyle.

Honest feedback - If you are interested in history then do visit as it has lots of handmade painting and foreign materials across palace.

Walking through Bangalore Palace felt like stepping into a fairytale. The majestic towers, stunning woodwork, and peaceful gardens left me in awe. Built in 1878, its charm and rich royal history make this place truly special. It's a beautiful window into Bangalore’s unique heritage and I absolutely loved my visit! Highly suggested place

> Beautiful and majestic historical palace.

> Stunning architecture with intricate carvings and designs.

> Well-maintained interiors and gardens.

> Audio guide and signboards available for easy understanding.

> Photography allowed only outside the palace.

> Entry fee high Rs .270.

> Best time to visit is in the evening.

Clean surroundings and good security.

placeMetadata.name: Ulsoor Lake

sources.snippet: Surrounded by greenery and well-maintained, Ulsoor Lake is one of the oldest and among the biggest in the city. With the slight breeze rippling through the water (with the most striking reflections!), the gentle swaying of trees around and the glorious sunshine lighting you up, you are sure to get some Instaworthy photos here. The pathway at the lake and the nearby war memorial are other locations you can try for some nice photos.

reviews.reviewText: Great place for walking, running, jogging and lake side view offers nice scenery. You can nicely get relax in the nature and enjoy birds sounds and fresh air.

Ulsoor Lake is one of the oldest and most well-known lakes in Bangalore. It is a large lake with small islands, and it offers a peaceful escape from the busy city life. The surroundings are green and quiet, making it a perfect place for morning walks, light jogging, or simply sitting and enjoying the cool breeze. Many people come here to spend time with family, friends, or even alone to relax and think. You can often see birds flying or sitting by the lake, and their sounds add to the calm feeling of the place. Boating is sometimes available, which is fun for kids and adults. There are benches to sit on, and the lake looks especially beautiful during sunrise and sunset, when the sky reflects on the water. Though the area could use a bit more maintenance in some parts, it still stays clean and safe for visitors. Ulsoor Lake is also close to temples and busy roads, but once you're near the water, it feels like a completely different world—quiet, natural, and refreshing. It’s a nice spot for anyone looking to enjoy a peaceful moment in the middle of the city.

A calm and peaceful spot in the city, great for a walk or just to sit and relax. The lake is nice, but there aren’t as many birds compared to BTM or Agara Lake. Maintenance could be better—some benches are broken, and two-wheeler parking is a hassle. Still, a decent place to unwind if you're in the area.

First,lake has good view and big overall , evening time is the best for walking and spending with family, As of now they are allowing for boating in the lake.

The trees and plants there are maintained good.

5/5

reviews.reviewText:
Cubbon Park in Bangalore is a fantastic spot to spend a weekend surrounded by nature. This park is known for its lush greenery, soothing atmosphere, and variety of flora, making it an ideal destination for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation.

*Highlights of Cubbon Park:*

- *Scenic Beauty*: The park boasts over 6,000 trees and plants, creating a serene environment perfect for unwinding.
- *Statues and Landmarks*: You'll find captivating statues of prominent personalities, such as Queen Victoria, King Edward VII, and Sir Mark Cubbon.
- *Recreational Activities*: Cubbon Park offers a toy train ride (Putani Express), a children's park (Jawahar Bal Bhawan), and a picturesque aquarium (Bangalore Aquarium).
- *Walking and Exercise*: The park has well-maintained paths for morning and evening walkers, making it a great spot for fitness enthusiasts.

*Things to Do:*

- Take a leisurely walk or jog around the park
- Explore the Bangalore Aquarium, which features a wide variety of fish species
- Enjoy the toy train ride with your kids
- Visit the Jawahar Bal Bhawan children's park for some fun activities
- Attend a concert or event at the Band Stand

*Practical Information:*

- *Timings*: Cubbon Park is open from 6 AM to 6 PM, except on Mondays and second Tuesdays.
- *Entry Fee*: There's no entry fee for the park, but some attractions like the aquarium have a small fee (Rs. 15 per person).
- *Parking*: There are four major parking lots near the park

Overall, Cubbon Park is a wonderful destination for a weekend getaway, offering a mix of natural beauty, recreational activities, and relaxation.
Highly Recommend......

A beautiful place to spend time, with an amusement park, boating, and stunning views of Kingfisher Tower. Conveniently located near a metro station, making travel easy. Perfect for a fun-filled day with family or friends!

Recommending to go feel the nature.. you can bring cook food and eat, don't forget to dump waste in the trash can, keep the park clean. You can have a relaxing day there, or you can try some creative work sitting in the nature.. you can go gor exercising.. beautiful place must go. You can also visit Vidhan Soudha from there.

Best places in Bangalore to relax and unwind. A beautifully maintained green space right in the heart of the city, it’s perfect for walking, jogging, or just spending quality time with friends and family. The park is clean, peaceful, and full of fresh air, making it a great escape from the city’s traffic and noise. Well-maintained paths and plenty of shaded areas make it enjoyable for all age groups

A peaceful and green escape right in the heart of Bangalore. Perfect place for morning walks, picnics, or just relaxing under the trees. Well-maintained with lots of open space and beautiful old trees. Loved the vibe, calm and refreshing amidst the city’s hustle. Great spot for nature lovers and families.

Nice park with lots of greenery and shady walking paths. The boating is enjoyable and there’s a unique stone “tila” area that stands out. The lotus pond needs better upkeep. Museum, library, and the nearby High Court add to the experience. Good spot for a relaxing break in the city.

placeMetadata.description: Botanical garden with an aquarium & glasshouse designed to mimic London's former Crystal Palace.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lalbagh Botanical Garden in Bangalore is a historic and expansive garden that originated as a private royal garden spanning 40 acres. Initially designed in Mughal style, it was further developed by Tipu Sultan and later expanded by British and Indian horticulturists. The garden is renowned for its support of agriculture, conservation of plant species, and contribution to the advancement of cultivation.
placeMetadata.address: Mavalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India

reviews.reviewText:
We visited Lalbagh Botanical Garden, during the Flower Show, and honestly… we were blown away! 😍 We had no idea that so many varieties of flowers even existed on this planet! It felt like stepping into a real-life fairy tale — vibrant colors, mesmerizing patterns, and fragrances that made us forget we were in the middle of a bustling city.

The floral displays were nothing short of magical — from exotic orchids and bonsais to massive floral installations that looked like they belonged in a fantasy movie. 🌺🌸🌼

We also explored the nursery section, and wow — it’s a hidden gem for any plant lover! 🌿🪴 We picked up a few beautiful plants and pots at surprisingly affordable rates. You could literally start your own mini garden without burning a hole in your pocket.

The whole experience was well-organized, the crowd was managed decently, and there were plenty of photo-worthy spots around every corner. 📸 If you’re in Bangalore and the flower show is on — don’t miss it. Even if it’s not, Lalbagh itself is a serene escape filled with greenery, history, and natural beauty.

Can’t wait to visit again during the next show! 💚

Visited Lalbagh and enjoyed the greenery and open space. It’s a nice place for a peaceful walk, photography, or just to relax.
The glass house is interesting, especially during the flower shows. Some areas could be better maintained, and certain paths need repairs. Entry is affordable, and it’s well-connected within the city.
Overall, a pleasant spot for nature lovers, though not everything feels as vibrant as it could be.

Lalbagh is one of the major attractions in Bengaluru. It is a paradise for nature lovers. It is a place to relax with the family. There is a large collection of various species of plants and flowers here. One of the most visited places here is the Glass House, which is built in imitation of the Crystal Palace in London. Other places of interest include the Floral Clock, Large Rock, Bonsai Garden, Cactus Garden, Rose Garden, Hibiscus Garden. There is a large and picturesque lake at the southern end of Lalbagh, which has a walking facility around it. There is also a bridge and a small fountain.

It has 4 gates for entry. Gates 1 and 2 are in the north, gate 3 is in the east, and gate 4 is in the west.

It is open from 6 am to 7 pm.

Entry is free from 6 am to 9 am and from 6 pm to 7 pm. The entry fee is 50 rupees at other time.

A beautiful and peaceful place right in the middle of the city! The garden is very well maintained, with so many different sections to explore. The Glass House, Bonsai Garden, and Lake area are perfect spots for photography and relaxing walks. The overall greenery and fresh air make it a refreshing experience.

We also visited during the Mango Festival, which was a wonderful bonus — so many varieties of fresh mangoes to taste and buy. The entire atmosphere was lively and enjoyable.

Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone looking for some calm time amidst nature. Best to visit early morning or late afternoon for pleasant weather and beautiful light for photos.

Lalbagh Botanical Garden is a wonderful place to visit. It’s a green and peaceful escape right in the middle of Bengaluru. The garden is beautifully maintained with many different types of plants and flowers.
The famous Glass House is the main attraction, especially during the flower shows. The large lake and the ancient rock with the watchtower are also great spots to see.
It’s the perfect spot for a relaxing walk, a picnic with family, or just to enjoy some fresh air. It’s a clean and calm oasis that offers a much-needed break from city life.

I recently visited Lalbagh Botanical Garden, and it was such a refreshing escape from the city chaos. Walking through the greenery and around the lake was so calming—I could spend hours just sitting and enjoying the view.

The Glass House was under construction when I visited, which was a bit disappointing, but honestly, there was still so much beauty around to enjoy. The garden is very well maintained, and I think it would take about half a day to really explore everything properly.

Overall, it was a peaceful and enjoyable experience. If you love nature, greenery, or just want a calm place to spend a few hours, this garden is definitely worth a visit!

Lalbagh Botanical Garden is one of the most iconic places to visit in Bangalore. Spread across lush greenery, it offers a refreshing escape from the city’s hustle and bustle, with its serene pathways, rich flora, and fresh air. The highlight of the garden is the grand flower shows held twice a year, which attract visitors from all over with their breathtaking floral displays. Whether you’re a nature lover, a photographer, or simply seeking a peaceful stroll, Lalbagh is truly a must-visit destination in Bangalore.

placeMetadata.name: National Gallery of Modern Art (Bengaluru)

sources.snippet: If you're an art lover, don't miss visiting the National Gallery of Modern Art on Palace Road. This gallery, which opened in 2009, is the third of its kind in India (the others are in Delhi and Mumbai). It's housed in a Colonial mansion with a garden setting and has two interconnected wings, one of which features works from the early 18th century up until India's Independence while the other displays work from a large number of modern and contemporary artists.

There are works by several contemporary artists here as well.

Once inside, you’ll be asked to leave your bags at the store near the entrance and collect a token. The main art gallery sits in a charming old building that itself feels like a piece of history. The ground floor is home to the incredible works of the legendary Nandalal Bose, while the upper floors are filled with artworks that truly stop you in your tracks – acrylics, watercolours, oils, mixed media, ink, and pencil sketches, all beautifully displayed.

The building’s design, its thoughtful upkeep, and the warm politeness of the staff deserve a special mention. Practical touches like the lift, auditorium, washrooms, and a small cafeteria on the ground floor make the visit even smoother.

The place is good with displays of art. The ticket costs Rs. 20 for Indians, there was no rush. There is a cafe , souvenir shop (both of them offer reasonable price for everything) as well as an art archive above the cafeteria. Personal photographs are not allowed, though you can take photos of the gallery. The security guards were not really welcoming, they kept on following us everywhere, which felt a bit intimidating

First visit, and I was honestly surprised. 20rs ticket, and what you get is priceless. Beautiful old building, peaceful garden, and rooms filled with art I’ve never seen before. Felt calm and curious the whole time. It’s not crowded or loud just quiet, thoughtful, and very different from usual places in Bangalore.

A perfect place to slow down and see something new.

Entry fee is just Rs. 20 for Indians. Every room has security personnel that are doing their job diligently, at times it feels like they are stalking you 😅 but they are super friendly and helpful. However, if you have any doubts, there's no one for clarification. I was told that guided tours are conducted on Wednesdays and Saturdays at 4 pm (please call the museum to confirm). There were paintings and sculptures (wooden, metal, stone, etc.). While it's kept well in terms of cleanliness and organization, there's lingering foul smell in the hall on the first floor. There's a gift shop, with the items reasonably priced. Behind that you could find the canteen (by the looks of it and the menu, I only purchased a water bottle). And beside the canteen, drinking water and bathrooms (not-so-clean) are available. Art library can be accessed from the adjacent staircase. I spent around 90 minutes, time well spent.

reviews.reviewText:
Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace in Bangalore is a must-visit destination for history buffs and architecture enthusiasts. This 18th-century palace, built in 1791, served as the summer retreat for Tipu Sultan, the ruler of Mysore. Here's what you can expect:

*Architecture and Features:*

- The palace is a beautiful example of Indo-Islamic architecture, with teak pillars, arches, and balconies.
- The two-storey structure has a stone plinth and wooden beams, with intricate carvings and floral motifs.
- The upper level has an open balcony area with projecting balconies where Tipu Sultan would hold court.

*Things to See and Do:*

- Explore the museum on the ground floor, showcasing Tipu Sultan's belongings, including his clothes, crown, and weapons.
- See the replica of Tipu's tiger, a mechanical tiger that symbolizes his victory over the British.
- Visit the durbar hall on the first floor, where Tipu Sultan would hold court, and admire the Zenana quarters, the private rooms for the royal ladies.
- Take a stroll in the well-manicured gardens and lawns in front of the palace ¹ ².

*Practical Information:*

- *Timings:* 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM, daily
- *Nearest Metro Station:* KR Market Metro Station
- *Getting There:* Take a cab or auto ride, as parking can be a hassle

*Tips:*

- Spend 1-2 hours exploring the palace and its surroundings.
- Consider a guided tour for a more in-depth understanding of the palace's history and architecture.
- Visit the nearby Bangalore Fort and Venkateswara Temple to make the most of your trip

Overall, Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace is a great place to visit if you're interested in history, architecture, or simply want to experience the city's cultural heritage.

placeMetadata.name: Vidhana Soudha

sources.snippet: Almost no imagery associated with Bangalore doesn't have the iconic Vidhana Soudha featured on it. The grand structure rests majestically in the Cubbon Park area, forming a perfect backdrop to this critical administrative hotbed of Bangalore. Commissioned by Kengal Hanumanthaiah, Bangalore's second Chief Minister, the building was constructed in a mix of Dravidian, Rajasthani and European architectural styles, as an answer to the colonial buildings surrounding it.

sources.snippet: The Vidhana Soudha opened in the year 1965 and is a major landmark of the Garden City. It is located just beside Cubbon Park and the imposing structure has four domes for four corners, manifesting Dravidian architectural themes at their finest. This complex has the Legislative Chamber of the Government of Karnataka and has several other departments of the government housed within it too.

placeMetadata.description: Massive, architecturally notable building housing the state legislative chambers.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vidhana Soudha is a massive and architecturally significant building that houses the state legislative chambers in Bangalore, Karnataka. It is a landmark structure constructed in a neo-Dravidian style, incorporating elements from various historical kingdoms. The building features imposing columns, a central dome topped with a structure resembling the state emblem, and watchtowers. As the seat of the Government of Karnataka, Vidhana Soudha captivates visitors with its grand granite construction and impressive design.

reviews.reviewText: This impressive building completed in 1956 is the seat of the Karnataka Legislature in Bengaluru, India. It's over 500,000 square feet. It is one of the prominent examples of post-independence architecture in India, it stands as a landmark of Karnataka’s identity, architecture, and culture. The building was constructed from grey granite. Interior was designed to reflect dignity and grandeur while showcasing Indian cultural values. High-quality native woods were used extensively throughout.  Wear comfy shoes, take water, wear hat, sunscreen.  Popular with tourists.  Beautiful place. Lots to see. Parking is hard to find.  Great place for photography.

Vidhana Soudha is one of Bangalore’s most renowned landmarks, serving as the seat of the Karnataka State Legislature and Secretariat. As a symbol of Karnataka’s political and cultural legacy, it exudes elegance, especially when illuminated at night.

While general entry is restricted, visitors can still appreciate its architectural brilliance from the outside, except during select official events. Conveniently situated near Cubbon Park and the Karnataka High Court, it is easily reachable via Namma Metro (Vidhana Soudha station). The lush greenery and well-kept surroundings enhance its charm, making it an excellent spot for sightseeing and photography. Whether you’re a resident or a tourist, this iconic monument is an unmissable part of Bangalore’s heritage.

Starting from June 1, they open for guided tours. Unfortunately i wasn't able to view guided visit but had a chance to view in night. Seeing the building at night is a special feeling. Kind of mesmerizing than in morning. Also less crowded at nights. No parking space available but good to walk along the pathway from nearby parking. Plan and Have a good visit.

I recently visited Vidhana Soudha and took the guided tour — it was a truly memorable experience! The architecture is absolutely magnificent, reflecting the grandeur of Indian democracy. The guide’s explanation was detailed and very engaging, which made the whole visit even more meaningful. The Speaker’s Gallery was especially awesome — a must-see! I highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in history, politics, or architecture.

This state legislature building is one of Bengaluru’s most iconic landmarks, known for its exquisite handwork, grand architecture, and heritage charm. The intricate details on the facade are a testament to the craftsmanship of a bygone era—truly a treat for history and architecture lovers.

It’s not just a historic site but also an important metro stop, with easy access to the High Court and Cubbon Park. However, the main road outside is extremely busy, and there’s very limited open space in front, so be cautious while visiting—especially if you're on foot or with children.

Despite that, it’s widely considered a must-visit location when in Bangalore. A great place to soak in the civic pride and cultural legacy of the city!

🏛️ Vidhana Soudha – The Pride of Karnataka’s Governance & Grandeur! 🌟🇮🇳

My visit to Vidhana Soudha, one of Bengaluru’s most iconic landmarks, was a powerful reminder of India's architectural brilliance and democratic strength. Whether you're a tourist, photographer, or a proud local, standing in front of this majestic structure fills you with awe and pride. 🙏📸

🏢 Architecture & History
The Vidhana Soudha is the seat of the Karnataka State Legislature and is one of the largest legislative buildings in India. Its architecture is a majestic blend of Dravidian, Rajasthani, and Indo-Saracenic styles.
Every part of this structure — from the massive granite columns to the intricately carved details — showcases the brilliance of Indian craftsmanship. The grandeur of the domes, the towering entrance, and the lush gardens surrounding it make it a visual treat. 🏰🌿

🇮🇳 The building bears the proud inscription: "Government Work is God's Work" — a reminder of the building’s purpose and its role in shaping the lives of millions in Karnataka.

📷 Photography Heaven
Though the building is not open to tourists for internal visits, the outside view is more than enough to impress. The sheer scale, symmetry, and the detailed carvings on this structure are a delight for photography lovers.
As you can see in my photos, the morning sunlight, cloudy skies, or evening lights — every time of the day gives it a unique charm. 📸🌤️🌆

🌳 Surroundings
Vidhana Soudha is surrounded by beautifully maintained lawns, iron fencing, and clean surroundings. Located near Cubbon Park and High Court, it’s in the heart of Bengaluru’s administrative zone. The whole area is ideal for a walking tour, especially early in the morning or late evening. 🌳🚶‍♂️

👮 Security & Access
Due to its political and administrative importance, entry is restricted, and security is tight — which is understandable. You can walk around the perimeter freely and take photos, but getting too close might not be allowed. Make sure to respect the rules and follow security guidelines. 🚫📷

🌇 Best Time to Visit
Early morning or post-sunset are ideal times to visit for the best photos. During evenings, the building is beautifully lit with golden lighting that makes it look like a royal palace. If you’re lucky to visit on Republic Day or Karnataka Rajyotsava, the whole area is decorated and feels even more special. ✨🇮🇳

💭 Final Thoughts
Vidhana Soudha isn’t just a building — it’s a symbol of democracy, power, and pride for Karnataka. Its grand presence makes you feel patriotic and respectful of the governance system. I highly recommend including this site in your Bengaluru itinerary, even if it's just for a peaceful walk and a few great pictures. 🌟📷

I recently visited Vidhana Soudha during the Book Fair Mela and had a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to go inside. It was open to the public for just a few days, and I feel lucky to have experienced it. In the evening, there was an amazing concert by Arjun Janya, which made the visit even more special. The building looks absolutely stunning when it's lit up at night. The area around is clean and green, perfect for a peaceful walk or to take some great photos. If you’re visiting Bengaluru, Vidhana Soudha is definitely a place you shouldn’t miss!

A Glimpse of Grandeur: Visiting Bangalore's Vidhana Soudha

For anyone interested in history, architecture, or a bit of local pride, the Vidhana Soudha is an essential stop in Bangalore. This massive granite building, which houses the state legislature of Karnataka, is more than just a government office—it's an impressive work of art and a powerful symbol of post-independence India.

Built in the 1950s, its architecture is often described as "Neo-Dravidian," a style that beautifully blends traditional South Indian temple elements with modern design. From the richly carved pillars and arches to the immense, sprawling layout, the building commands attention. At the very top, a striking dome sits, crowned with the four-headed national emblem.

The most famous feature, and a must-see for visitors, is the inscription on the front: "Government's Work is God's Work" in both English and Kannada.While you can't go inside the working government building, simply standing in front of it is an experience in itself. The sheer scale is breathtaking.

The best time to visit is in the evening, especially on Sundays and public holidays, when the entire structure is illuminated with thousands of lights. It's a truly spectacular sight that makes you appreciate the city's unique blend of tradition and modernity. Vidhana Soudha stands as a testament to the state's heritage and a true landmark for all of India.

reviews.reviewText: Very nice place 🥰my kids happy so much 💗 It is a very nice place. You can spend the whole day here. There are a lot of rides and a lot of 🤩 fun Kids can enjoy a lot.water park super 👌

Jollywood is a great place to go for a one day outing. It had lots of fun 🤩physical experiences like Sky swing, spinning pendulum ride and many more games.

The 100 years of Indian Cinema show in Jubilee theatre 🎭 was amazing. All the live art and dance performances were fantastic and have unique dimension to them that is usually missing in digital media.

There were also lots of sets like Titanic and Jurassic Park etc which were surreal and delightful.

Overall it is a great place to go with friends and family 😃

Fun theme park for all ages. Ticket prices are around 1500 per person which includes lunch/dinner and most of the free activities. Some activities are paid as well. The park is clean and maintained well. Parking space is enough may be because it's quite far from the city and may not be rushed on weekends like nandi hills. The food included in the Ticket is below average. There is a paid food section which is costly but better than the free one.

Activities are plenty and you will end up spending 5-6 hours. Overall it felt expensive will all the toll you pay and below average food you get included on the Ticket. And the worst part is the Ticket price is more if you don't want the food included. One time visit recommended.
Don't miss the 5D film, Titanic park, Lost World, 5pm Theatre dance, Miniature park, Glow Park. It's quite a good film City for 4-5 hrs. Must visit. Preebook the tickets and then visit.

Good place with lots of wet and dry rides. Cater to all age group. We went with senior citizen, 11 year old and 3 year old. All had fun. Buy tickets from district app. You will get good discount. Tickets at the counter are  expensive than online. Outside home cooked food is allowed but anything packaged food is not allowed.

It is so good place with a lot of rides like samba balloon,  bumper car,  cycling in rope, zipline, carousel etc,  Indoor games like bouncy vastle, bull ride, 5d show, Archery,  trampoline area in a beautiful palace themed area.
They have a wonderful Waterpark containing a beach type feel wave pool with sand and trees and gazebos , family pool with slides , rain dance area and a thrill water rides pool but the changing rooms are not so convenient...
There is also a tribal museum, titanic theme  stimulation n show but at restricted times  glow in dark area, dinosaur theme park with a train ride n a small museum, emu birds park , walls full of filmy posters in the entrance,  playtopia - a play zone for kids and lastly miniature city which has literally nothing more than a castle and a bridge.
They  have 3 shows in the evening ... one at 5 pm - dance performance in jubilee theatre , other at 6pm - since european parade and lastly at 7pm- laser twilight show.
The are many restaurent also but quality of food is not so good....
Everything was great but most of the staff are not willing to work or show any interest towards their job.... after repeatedly asking few staff are switching on the rides on weekdays.

I had an absolutely fantastic time at Jollywood, Innovative Film City located in Bidadi. It’s a vibrant and fun-filled destination that gives you a taste of the movie world in a creative and engaging way. The entire space is thoughtfully designed to offer immersive experiences — perfect for all age groups.

Some of the highlights of my visit included walking through Maze Runner, which was thrilling and full of twists! The Lost World was another favorite — with life-sized dinosaur models and prehistoric vibes that made it feel like stepping back in time. The Titanic setup was beautifully recreated and made for some amazing photo ops. Each themed section was well-maintained and truly brought the concepts to life.

I also loved exploring the Miniature City, which was incredibly detailed and showcased tiny replicas of famous landmarks — a real treat for both kids and adults. The live street dance performance brought the whole place alive with music and energy, and added a festive touch to the experience. There’s also a kids' play area that’s perfect for families with young children, offering plenty of activities to keep them engaged and entertained.

Overall, Jollywood offers a wonderful mix of adventure, creativity, and entertainment. Whether you’re looking to explore themed zones, enjoy live performances, or just click some memorable pictures, this place has it all. A highly recommended weekend getaway from Bengaluru!

Innovative Film City (Jollywood) is a one-time visit destination. Given the ticket price and amenities offered, I felt it was on the pricier side compared to Wonderla. However, the final fountain show was a highlight and truly enjoyable.

reviews.reviewText: I have in the past planned parties for elegant gatherings mostly at 5star hotels, but this time I decided to try delivering a five star experience in a less expected way. I chose satori because it is located just three minutes from Palm meadows where my guests were coming from, it is beautiful, elegant, charming... And most of all, warm and welcoming. Nothing in the past I've done has come even close to it. Thank you team satori.

I had booked the place for my birthday party and had a great time there! The place is beautiful and well spread out and is good for both large & small gatherings. The Manager Mr. Kumar is very helpful and will ensure you face no difficulties during your event. Overall, a great experience!
Lovely place, been there to attend colleagues wedding and the atmosphere was awesome. Lovely place to spend the day with your special one.

placeMetadata.name: KR Market

sources.snippet: This expansive space is believed to be the largest flower market in Asia. Reportedly built on an old battleground, you’ll also find a few vegetable and fruit vendors as well as stores with other commodities. KR Market is also one of the busiest places in the city, and the chaos is what appeals to most photographers.

sources.snippet: It consists of three markets, each with their own specialization. The area was actually built on an old battleground and was the first place to receive electricity in Asia. placeMetadata.generatedDescription: If you want to immerse yourself in the bustling atmosphere of Bangalore, look no further than KR Market. This vibrant market offers a wide array of goods, from copper items and spices to fresh produce and flowers. Navigating through the crowds can be overwhelming, so consider joining a guided tour to explore the market's history and secure great deals. Named after a former ruler of Mysore/Mysuru, this market is particularly famous for its early morning flower sellers who depart by breakfast time.

sources.snippet: Part of our rooftop bars and stunning view lists (read about them here and here), Skyye is the perfect spot to get those landscape shots of the city’s skyline. At 16 floors high, it also means unobstructed views for as far as the eye can see. With Cubbon Park nearby, one side overlooks the lush green space (and at night it’s like a dark carpet with street lights dotting it), the other in the CBD that comes alive with all sorts of lights, you’ve got yourself a picture worth clicking and sharing away!

Skyye in Bangalore is the perfect spot to click panoramic views of the city along with its skyline at night. This 16-floor high building offers a breathtaking birds-eye view of Cubbon Park too.

Pricing is decent given the location and experience.

placeMetadata.description: Scenic lake with walking trails, recreation & picnic areas, also known for its vast bird population.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hesaraghatta Lake, situated 18 km northwest of Bengaluru in Karnataka, is a picturesque freshwater lake and manmade reservoir. Built in 1894 across the Arkavathy River to meet the city's water needs, it offers walking trails, recreation areas, and picnic spots. The vast grasslands surrounding the 1620-hectare lake make it an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts.
placeMetadata.address: Bengaluru, Hesaraghatta Grass Farm, Karnataka 560089

reviews.reviewText: Peaceful spot within 30 kilometres range from Bangalore. The lake has long stretch of walking paths which you can walk. The cars can also come here with parking availability. It’s a calm & soothing place to come with friends & family. Make sure to have caps and water bottle because it’s very hot of you are visiting during day.

This is a beautiful lake in the city outskirts. One can go here for a long drive. Has a walking trail around one side of the lake. Now the lake is under BWSSB. There is a temple on the walking path. Peaceful surrounding unless the chaotic crowd is present. Many birds and water species can be seen. Good for family and kids outing.

If you're looking for a peaceful escape into nature, Sunset Point Lake View is a hidden gem that deserves a visit.
The spot is elevated just enough to give a panoramic view, making it perfect for photography or just soaking in the moment.

Hesaraghatta Lake is a beautiful and serene place, perfect for anyone looking to spend some quiet time in nature. Though the lake isn’t always full, the vast open spaces and the scenic surroundings create a calm and refreshing atmosphere. It’s a great spot for bird watching, photography, and simply enjoying a peaceful walk away from the city noise.
The sunsets here are particularly stunning, casting golden hues across the landscape. I would recommend visiting early in the morning or during sunset for the best experience.
Overall, a wonderful place to unwind and connect with nature!

If you’re looking for a peaceful spot to chill in the evenings, Hesaraghatta Lake is a hidden gem just outside Bangalore. It’s quiet, breezy, and perfect for watching the sunset 🌅 or just unwinding with friends ✨. No crowds, no noise — just nature and calm vibes 🌿. Great for a quick escape from the city chaos 🧘‍♂️. Definitely worth a visit!

Well maintained good for evening relaxation
You will get a good view of sunset here can't play with lake water

The combination of a peaceful walk, a beautiful sunset, the calls of peacocks, and cool breeze paints a perfect picture of an escape to Hesaraghatta. It's a truly serene spot away from the city bustle. 🌅

The area around the lake is dotted with trails, perfect for nature walks or cycling. The cool breeze and the sounds of nature add to the calming atmosphere, making it an ideal place for relaxation and contemplation. Despite the challenges of urbanization, Hesaraghatta Lake remains a vital green space and a testament to Bangalore's natural heritage.

For those seeking a break from the city, a visit to Hesaraghatta Lake offers a chance to reconnect with nature and enjoy the simple, yet profound beauty of the natural world.

placeMetadata.name: Blossom Book House

sources.snippet: Obscure Sanskrit dictionaries, piles of fiction precariously stacked away, old books of sheet music, travelogues, rare comic books, manga, and even LPs — plenty to Instagram and of course, buy!. Blossom Book House is an institution that needs no introduction and take it from us when we say that whenever we post about this good old second-hand book store, the likes are far too many!. We suggest you round off your day at Blossoms with some mouth watering pizza from Brik Oven right across the street.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots In The City

sources.snippet: The hub of ancient books, poetry, and stories, Blossom Book House, is the best place for bookworms and photographers alike who  travel to India to have a unique experience. Where: 6, Church St, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru - 560001.

placeMetadata.description: Urban, secondhand bookseller with a sizable collection of titles in fiction, cooking & other genres.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Blossom Book House, located on Church Street in Bangalore, is a beloved secondhand bookstore that opened its doors in 2001. It's the largest of its kind in India and a must-visit for book enthusiasts. The store is packed with shelves filled with an extensive collection of fiction, cooking books, and more. Visitors can easily get lost among the stacks of books piled in every nook and cranny.
placeMetadata.address: 2, 3rd Floor, Prestige Commercial Complex, Church St, above Matteo Coffea, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText: Blossoms is a book lover’s dream! The cozy ambiance, well-organized shelves, and diverse collection make it a perfect spot to get lost in literature. Whether you’re into bestsellers, classics, or niche genres, they’ve got something for everyone. The staff is knowledgeable and always ready with great recommendations. A must-visit for anyone who loves books! 📚✨

Ummmm I love this place. It's a must visit for book lovers visiting Bangalore. They have humongous collection of both second hand and new books.
I especially love the various categories and genres of books they have on display(they even have a separate romance section)!
The books are mostly organized in their proper sections but it's a lot of disorganization. But to be frank I don't mind that - because the best part of books is the serendipity of stumbling on books and Blossoms does this spectacularly.
Also they delivery within the city without charges (maybe that's available for purchases above a certain value). The manager of the store was very friendly and helpful.
- 🍀✨Serendipity index - very high
- 👀 📖☕️ Browsing index - very high, you can sit for hours without anybody disturbing you and juste joy the place or flip through books.Also know that some sections of the store can get musty with ac not working.
- 🏷️%  Discount/membership - No
- 🧾🔖📚Secondhand books - Yes a very wide variety available. The prices are a bit steep for second hand books found elsewhere but the place makes up for it with sheet variety of books available so buy accordingly.
- 🗺️📚Regional books - Average. Limited collection of Hindi and Kannada books. The store is pre dominantly English.
- 🦹🏼‍♀️ Comics - Huge. I love their collection of magazines, they have so many ! But their condition and maintenance is not the best. A lot of them are chucked into boxes haphazardly and get torn up very easily. Also the comics are not cheap even the second hand ones. Can get for much cheaper from other places but then the titles are harder to find so it's a balancing act. The Manga collection is also huge.
- ♿ Wheelchair index - Low. While there is a ramp and lift both are nearly useless from a wheelchair user's perspective - ramp is too steep and the lift is a bit narrow to enter.
- 🅿️🚘Parking - Difficult. There is no parking in front of the store but the metro station entrance is nearby.

Blossom Book House offers an extensive selection of pre-loved books, all at remarkably low prices, often ranging from ₹200 to ₹600 depending on the condition and rarity.

Though there aren’t many comfy spots to sit and read, the space itself is vast, spanning an entire building floor with bookshelves at every turn. You’ll find everything from obscure comics to children’s books to literary classics.

When it comes to classics, they stock multiple editions and translations. I personally love the Everyman’s Library prints, and if you look hard enough, you’ll spot a few tucked away in the far corners.

Despite its long-standing popularity, Blossom retains a chill, unpretentious charm that encourages slow, meandering hours of discovery. A must-visit for book lovers!

Honestly, I could stay there for the rest of my life; there’s just so much to explore. There are actually two separate stores: the first one is for music, philosophy, and similar subjects, and just a short walk away there’s a second building. On its first floor is the store I love most. It’s filled with books on psychology, poetry, classic literature, etc.. Outside the store, you can also buy postcards, tote bags, and more. So you really have to set aside at least four hours if you want to visit even once (only if you like hunting for good books)🎯✨️🍀
Blossom Book House has a huge collection of old and new books. It also has branded merchandise. No place to sit, though. But hours can easily pass just browsing the stock of books.

Blossom Book House – Bangalore's Literary Treasure

Nestled in the heart of Shanthala Nagar and Ashok Nagar, Blossom Book House is a haven for book lovers and literary wanderers alike. The moment you step inside, you're greeted by the scent of old pages and the quiet magic of knowledge. Towering shelves crammed with books from floor to ceiling create an enchanting labyrinth, inviting you to lose yourself in its vast collection. Whether you seek fiction, rare editions, academic texts, or hidden second-hand gems, there’s something for every curious mind.

The charm of Blossom lies in its beautifully chaotic yet deeply curated arrangement. The friendly staff are passionate and well-read, often guiding customers to titles they never knew they needed. From international bestsellers to regional literature in multiple languages, the diversity in genres is astounding. The pricing is also reasonable, making literature accessible to all. It’s not just a store—it’s a celebration of stories and intellect.

What makes Blossom Book House truly unforgettable is its soul. In a time where digital dominates, this store offers an escape—a space to disconnect from screens and reconnect with words. Locals, students, travelers, and authors alike frequent this beloved landmark. Spending an hour here feels like stepping into a different world, and every visit leaves you with more than just books—it leaves you inspired.
K.vinoth

Amazing place. It's got pretty much every book and genre you can think of. If you love books, you should definitely check out this place, it has all the classics, the biographies and autobiographies, romance novels, YA novels, sci-fi and fantasy, mystery, everything.

Blossom Bookstore in Bangalore is an absolute gem for book lovers! Tucked away in the vibrant lanes of Church Street, this independent bookstore has something for everyone—from rare, out-of-print treasures to the latest releases at fantastic prices. What truly sets Blossom apart is its incredible collection of hard-to-find books. If you're on the hunt for a specific rare title or an out-of-print classic, this place is a haven. You’ll often find hidden gems tucked away in every corner, making it a booklover's paradise.

Not only does Blossom excel in rare and second-hand books, but they also offer an impressive selection of new books with great deals. Whether you're looking for the latest bestseller or a unique, niche title, their shelves are well-curated and reasonably priced.

As a delightful surprise, Blossom also boasts an unexpectedly fantastic vinyl collection. For music enthusiasts, it’s the perfect spot to discover records, spanning a variety of genres. Whether you’re a collector or just starting your vinyl journey, you’re sure to find some hidden treasures.

All in all, Blossom Bookstore is a must-visit for anyone in Bangalore—an unassuming yet exceptional place for books and music!

Avenue Road is always packed with people, covering the sidewalks and street the whole length.

Review: Bookstores on Avenue Road, Bengaluru

Avenue Road in Bengaluru is a paradise for book lovers, offering a diverse collection of bookstores that cater to all kinds of readers. Known for its bustling atmosphere and narrow lanes packed with shops, this area is a treasure trove for students, researchers, and literature enthusiasts alike.

The bookstores here offer an extensive range of books, from academic textbooks and competitive exam guides to novels, rare editions, and second-hand books at bargain prices. Many shops also stock old and out-of-print books, making it an excellent place for those searching for hard-to-find titles. Street vendors add to the charm by selling books at highly discounted rates.

One of the biggest attractions of Avenue Road is the affordability. Compared to mainstream bookstores, prices here are significantly lower, and shoppers can even negotiate for better deals. However, the sheer number of shops and the crowded environment can be overwhelming for first-time visitors. Additionally, finding a specific book may require some patience and effort.

Despite these minor challenges, Avenue Road remains a must-visit destination for book lovers in Bengaluru. Whether you're looking for academic material or a hidden literary gem, the bookstores here offer something for everyone at unbeatable prices.
Properly hectic. It’s interesting to walk the full length and take it all in.
Very good place for shopping books. Excellent collections of books.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Bannerughatta Biological Park, located on the outskirts of South Bangalore, is a renowned wildlife conservation center and the first biological recreation center in India to house a butterfly farm. The park aims to preserve wildlife and educate younger generations about its importance. With around 1500 animals, including leopards, wild boars, sloth bears, elephants, lions, tigers and cheetahs, it offers visitors an opportunity to observe these creatures up close through vehicle tours.

reviews.reviewText:
Bannerghatta National Park in the afternoon (around 3 PM to 6 PM) and it was a really nice experience. The timing was perfect — many wild animals could be seen from quite near, making it exciting and memorable.

The entry ticket is reasonably priced: ₹120 per adult for the walking trail, and around ₹500 if you choose the electric vehicle (which is more comfortable and covers more ground).

The park is surrounded by beautiful nature, with greenery and fresh air all around. It’s a peaceful, well-maintained area, perfect for a weekend outing with family or friends.

If you love wildlife and want to enjoy a relaxed afternoon in nature, this is definitely worth visiting.

I visited Bannerghatta National Park today along with two of my friends and had a really good time. It’s a nice getaway from the city hustle, just about an hour from Bangalore. The bus safari was the best part - got to see lions, tigers, and bears up close, safely from the bus. It felt exciting and a bit thrilling too!

There’s also a zoo inside with a variety of animals, birds, and reptiles. It’s not huge, but it’s fun, especially for kids. The butterfly park was peaceful and colorful - beautifully maintained and a good spot to relax and take photos. This might be very informative for students.

Staff are fantastic, quick and very supportive as I had some confusion on a ticket transaction. Written an email and they responded with all clarifications. Which clearly reflects how efficiently in therms of caring its visitors. Really appreciable.

Food options inside are limited, so it’s a good idea to carry your own snacks and water. Overall, it’s a great place for a day trip with family or friends, especially if you love nature and wildlife. Highly, highly recommended. 😊

✨ Had an amazing time at Bannerghatta Zoo & Safari! 🐅🦓🦒
The safari was the highlight — got to see tigers, lions, elephants, deer, and even a lazy bear up close. It really feels like a mini adventure inside the forest. The zoo area is also well maintained with a good variety of animals, birds, and reptiles.

The whole place is quite green and refreshing, perfect for a day outing. Would recommend going in the morning for better chances of spotting animals and to avoid the rush. Overall, a fun and memorable experience! 🌿🐾

A great mix of nature and wildlife just outside the city!
It is a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of Bangalore. The park offers a unique experience with its safari rides, zoo, butterfly park, and rescue center. The safari was the highlight — spotting lions, tigers, and bears in semi-open enclosures felt thrilling and pretty close to nature. It’s perfect for kids and families.
What I liked:
Safari experience is exciting and safe.
Natural surroundings and greenery.
Butterfly park is well-maintained.
Good for a day trip from Bangalore.

Visited Bannerghatta National Park with my 2-year-old boy and we had a wonderful time! He really enjoyed watching the animals and was super excited during the safari. The park is quite well-maintained and offers a great experience for kids. It was a bit crowded since we went on a weekend, so I’d recommend visiting on a weekday if possible for a more peaceful experience. Overall, a great place for a family outing!

The safari here was the best part  seeing tigers, lions, and bears up close was amazing! The zoo has a good variety of animals too, great for kids and families. It does get crowded on weekends and could use better maintenance in some areas. Ticketing also takes a bit of time, but overall it’s a really nice day trip from Bangalore. Definitely worth visiting for the safari.

A wonderful day out at Bannerghatta Biological Park! My twin boys were overjoyed seeing animals for real for the first time, an unforgettable experience for them. The zoo has a well-rounded assortment of animals, though the count of each species is limited. It's a great place for kids to explore and learn. We didn’t try the safari this time, but that’s on our list for the next visit. Highly recommend for a family outing!

Bannerghatta National Park is a wonderful getaway for nature and wildlife lovers. The bus safari combo ticket is highly recommended — it’s affordable and gives access to both the jungle safari and the zoo, making it a great value-for-money package.

The jungle safari is a must-try experience. It lasts for around 45 minutes, taking you deep into the forest reserve. During the ride, we had the chance to spot majestic animals like lions, tigers, white tigers, leopards, deer, bears, and even elephants. It's thrilling to see these animals in a semi-natural habitat, roaming freely within their designated enclosures.

The zoo is equally impressive, featuring a wide variety of animals, birds, reptiles, and more. Each enclosure has information displayed about the species, which makes the visit both fun and educational. It's a great place for families and children to learn more about wildlife conservation.

Overall, Bannerghatta National Park offers a well-rounded and enjoyable wildlife experience — adventurous, informative, and ideal for a day trip from Bangalore.

placeMetadata.name: ISKCON Bangalore

sources.snippet: Located in the Rajajinagar area, ISKCON Temple is a revered shrine dedicated to Lord Krishna. The temple, under the guidance of Madhu Pandit Dasa, was inaugurated in the year 1997 by Shankar Dayal Sharma. Apart from a religious shrine, ISKCON temple is a cultural complex accommodating dedicated deities of Sri Sri Radha Krishnachandra, Sri Sri Krishna Balarama, Sri Sri Nitai Gauranga, Sri Srinivasa (Read More) Govinda and Sri Prahlada Narasimha.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Bangalore | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Sri Radha Krishna Temple is one of the biggest ISKCON temples in the world. It is located at Rajajinagar, Bangalore. This temple is a major places to visit in Bangalore due to the attraction of tourists.

placeMetadata.description: Expansive, modern Hare Krishna temple campus, including shrines, food stalls & souvenir shops.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The ISKCON temple in Bangalore, located in Rajaji Nagar, is a magnificent tribute to Lord Krishna. The temple was built on a 7-acre campus and took 6 years to complete. Designed by Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa, the architecture features a stunning 17-meter gold-plated flag post and 8.5-meter gold Kalash Shikaras. Situated on Hare Krishna Hill, the temple's Neo-Classical style blends modern amenities with traditional design.
placeMetadata.address: Hare Krishna Hill, Chord Rd, 1st R Block, Rajajinagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560010, India

reviews.reviewText:
ISKCON Temple in Rajajinagar, Bangalore, is a remarkable spiritual destination that impresses visitors with its blend of traditional Dravidian and modern architectural styles. The temple’s glass elements and intricately designed structures create a breathtaking ambiance, making it a visual delight from the moment you enter. The journey into the temple is thoughtfully planned, starting from the beautiful Kalyani (sacred pond) and passing through the 108 footstep station, where chanting the Hare Krishna mantra offers a calming and introspective experience.

The temple houses several deities, including Lord Prahlada Narasimha Swami, Lord Srinivasa Govinda (Venkateshwara), and the main sanctum dedicated to Sri Krishna Balarama and Sri Radha Krishna Chandra. The presence of Lord Krishna here is especially significant—devotees believe that worshipping at this temple brings peace, happiness, and spiritual upliftment. The regular Sri Krishna sankirtana (devotional singing) fills the air with a sense of tranquility and helps devotees connect deeply with the divine.

The surroundings are exceptionally clean and well-maintained, and the temple is known for its orderly management and welcoming atmosphere. The staff are respectful, and the entire complex is designed to facilitate a smooth and enriching visit for all. The temple also offers prasadam (blessed food) and has a vegetarian restaurant within the premises, adding to the overall experience.

Whether you are seeking spiritual solace, architectural beauty, or simply a peaceful retreat in the heart of Bangalore, ISKCON Rajajinagar is a must-visit. The divine presence of Lord Krishna and the serene environment make it a place where one can truly feel blessed and rejuvenated.

This temple is truly mesmerizing, with grand architecture and an expansive layout that reflects its cultural and spiritual significance. The temple complex spans a vast area, and it typically takes around 15–20 minutes to walk from the entrance gate to the main sanctum. The atmosphere is serene and divine, offering a peaceful experience despite the weekend crowds. Fortunately, our darshan was smooth and well-managed.

Prasadam is served between 11:00 AM and 2:00 PM. In addition to that, there are several food stalls within the temple premises offering light snacks and meals that are prepared and served as prasadam, allowing visitors to enjoy traditional flavors in a devotional setting.

Photography is not permitted inside the temple, preserving its sanctity; however, visitors are welcome to take photos in the outer areas of the temple complex.

I visited on a Saturday evening around 6 PM. The place was quite crowded, yet the volunteers and devotees were managing everything very well. Footwear can be kept in a sack for a nominal charge of ₹5–₹10, or at the free slipper stand. Since I wasn’t carrying any cash and there was no digital payment option, the staff kindly helped me by keeping my slippers safely in a sack.

One of the most unique aspects was at the first entry level into the sanctum, where every devotee is asked to chant “Hara Krishna Hara Rama” 108 times. With each step, the chant continues until one reaches the first temple dedicated to Lord Narasimha. Photography inside the sanctum is strictly prohibited, which helps preserve the sanctity of the space.

The sequence of the sanctums is as follows:

First: Lord Narasimha, Lord Anjaneya, and Garuda

Second: Lord Venkatachalapati

Final: Radha Krishna

Inside, one truly feels the divine bliss and a sense of oneness with Lord Krishna. The atmosphere stands out for its cleanliness, absence of beggars, and the fact that no one pressures you to make donations. While special darshan options are available, even the free darshan is fulfilling and complete.

On the way out, there are stalls with spiritual books such as Lord Krishna Leela and the Bhagavad Gita. A variety of good-quality food items are also available at very reasonable prices. Additionally, hot khichdi prasad is continuously served to devotees, adding to the overall divine experience.

Visited ISKCON Bangalore and was truly mesmerized by the experience. The place has a very unique and serene vibe — where spirituality and architecture come together beautifully. What stood out most was the view of four majestic temple structures aligned in a single line of sight — absolutely stunning and unlike anything I’ve seen before.

A peaceful atmosphere, well-maintained premises, and an experience that leaves you feeling calm and uplifted. Definitely worth a visit, whether you’re spiritual or simply seeking a moment of quiet reflection.

The ISKCON Temple in Bangalore is very well maintained and offers a peaceful atmosphere. It welcomes both devotees and tourists, giving the place a lively yet spiritual feel. The surroundings are clean, organized, and ideal for prayer or meditation. Accessibility is also convenient, as it’s located close to the Green Line metro station.

ISKCON Bangalore is a very peaceful and beautifully maintained temple. The atmosphere, prayers, and architecture truly give a spiritual experience. However, the ground floor feels a bit commercial with too many stalls, which takes away from the temple vibe. It would be better if the shopping areas were placed outside the main temple premises. Still, a must-visit for the spiritual energy. Hare Krishna A

The ISKCON Temple in Bangalore is a peaceful and spiritual place to visit. It is beautifully built and very clean. The temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, and the atmosphere is calm and full of devotion. The chants and prayers make you feel relaxed and connected. The temple has beautiful idols, and the main hall is very grand. There is also a small museum, gift shops, and places to eat. The prasadam is very tasty and free for visitors. It’s a nice place for families and tourists who want to experience Indian culture and spirituality.
However, they can improve the queue management system to enter the temple, especially during weekends and festivals when it gets very crowded, so weekdays are better for visit.
Overall, it’s a great place to find peace, pray, and enjoy a spiritual experience.

The temple is truly beautiful, just like any other temple dedicated to Krishna. The energy and vibe inside are incredibly uplifting and vibrant. However, I couldn't help but feel that the numerous shops within the premises make it seem more like a shopping center, which somewhat takes away from the spiritual atmosphere and is not very appealing.

placeMetadata.address: 28th km, Mysore Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 562109, India

reviews.reviewText: Me and my friends went to Wonderla, and it was an amazing day full of fun and laughter. The rides are thrilling, especially the water rides which are perfect to beat the heat. The park is well maintained, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Food options inside are decent, and there are many spots to relax between rides. Overall, it was a day well spent, and we came back with lots of good memories. Highly recommended if you want to have a fun day with your friends!

Really great place to unwind with family amazed about crowd management, cleanliness everything. Water area is absolutely clean. Overall the experience is world class.Go for all the dry rides before lunch. Post-lunch go for water slides, wave pool Giant Wheel gives pretty sunset views.

Wonderla is an amazing place to spend a fun-filled day with family and friends. The park offers a perfect mix of excitement and entertainment with its wide variety of rides. The dry games are thrilling and well-maintained, giving an adrenaline rush for adventure lovers. On the other hand, the water games are equally fantastic, offering both relaxation and excitement with wave pools, slides, and unique water rides.

The park is clean, well-organized, and managed efficiently. Safety measures are followed properly, and the staff is helpful and polite. Food options inside are decent, and there are plenty of resting spots available.

Good rides, quite safe and robust infra, decent number of food stalls, maps were given to navigate well, water rides were nice and water also looked decently hygienic.

Interstellar was also a very good virtual reality experience.

Fastrack is a big time saver if you're going on days school kids would visit

Wonderful Wonderla!

We booked the birthday offer online and got a fast-track ticket plus food at the entrance. It was a bit pricey, at 2.5k per person.

However, you’ll regret going in with the normal ticket. Each ride requires at least a 40-minute wait.

To make the most of your time, plan your rides around the 11-7 plan. Start with the least crowded rides first. We began with the Recoil. Sitting in the first seat was a huge and fearful experience, but it was worth it. You’ll be able to see the other rides without feeling so scared.

Overall, it was a great experience, and it was worth every penny.

My friends and I recently visited Wonderla, and it was a truly memorable experience!

We went on a weekday, and surprisingly, the crowd was relatively manageable. We started with the land rides, and all of them were equally thrilling and packed with adrenaline. Don’t miss Recoil—it was one of the most exciting and fun rides of the day!

When it came to lunch, I felt that opting for a food coupon along with the ticket would’ve been a better deal. The food was quite good in terms of both quality and quantity.

After lunch, we headed to the water rides. But in the afternoon, the queues were long. I don’t recall the names of the rides we tried, but they were all great fun and absolutely worth the wait.

The only disappointing part was that the park closes at 5 PM on weekdays. It would be better if the weekday timings matched the weekend hours to give visitors more time to enjoy everything.

If you're planning to visit on a weekend, be prepared for heavy crowds and long waiting lines. I highly recommend going for fast-track tickets if you want to make the most of your day.

They offer locker rooms to keep your valuables safe, with a charge of ₹300 per locker.

Also, there's plenty of parking space, and the parking is free.

Best place to spend your time and money. Nice thrilling rides especially wonder flash & roller coaster is a must try in dry games and in water game vertical fall is a must try one. Neat and well maintained restrooms . Newly added ride is a space ride . Wonderfully coverd and maintained one of the must try one.

Drawback is food price.

I visited Wonderla recently and had an absolutely awesome experience! I entered the park around 11:20 AM and stayed until closing at 6:00 PM, and I must say, every minute was worth it.
From the moment I stepped in, the place had a vibrant and energetic vibe. I managed to cover all the land and water rides, which was no small feat – but totally exhilarating. The land rides were packed with thrills – from high-adrenaline roller coasters to fun family-friendly attractions. Each ride was well-maintained and the staff were courteous and helpful throughout.
The water rides were a highlight for me – a perfect way to beat the heat. Whether it was the wave pool, lazy river, or the steep water slides, each experience added to the fun. Everything felt safe and clean, which made the whole adventure even more enjoyable.
The park was well-organized, and despite the crowds, the queues moved fairly quickly. There were plenty of food options and resting areas, so I never felt overwhelmed.
Overall, it was a day full of fun, excitement, and unforgettable memories. I’d highly recommend Wonderla to anyone looking for a complete amusement park experience – whether you're an adrenaline junkie or just out to have a great time with friends and family.

It is a marvellous sight to behold with its towering façade, glass windows, and the loving statues of Mother Mary.

reviews.reviewText:
St. Mary's Basilica, located in the heart of Shivajinagar, Bengaluru, is the oldest church in the city and holds the distinction of being the only church in Karnataka elevated to the status of a minor basilica.  Its origins trace back to the 17th century when Tamil Christian migrants from Gingee settled in the area and built a thatched chapel known as the "Chapel of Kanikkai Madha."  Over the centuries, the church underwent several transformations, culminating in its consecration in 1882.  In 1973, it was granted the status of a minor basilica by Pope Paul VI, making it the sixth church in India to receive this honor  .

Mass Timings:
St. Mary's Basilica offers daily Masses in multiple languages, catering to the diverse congregation.  Masses are conducted in English, Tamil, Kannada, Konkani, and Malayalam at various times throughout the week.  The basilica also observes special services such as the Divine Mercy Prayer daily at 3:00 PM and Holy Hours on the first Friday of every month from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM  .

Annual Feast:
The basilica is renowned for the St. Mary's Feast, celebrated annually in September.  The festivities commence with a nine-day Novena from August 30th to September 7th, culminating in the grand feast on September 8th, commemorating the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary.  The celebrations include processions, special Masses, and cultural events, drawing thousands of devotees from across the region  .

Visiting Information:
Location: Msgr. F. Noronha Road, Shivajinagar, Bengaluru – 560 051

Visiting Hours: The basilica is open daily from early morning until evening.

Accessibility: Easily accessible via public transportation, with the Shivajinagar Bus Terminus nearby and Cubbon Park Metro Station within close proximity

Nestled in the heart of Shivajinagar, St. Mary’s Basilica is one of the most peaceful and spiritually uplifting places in Bengaluru. As one of the oldest churches in the city, it holds a deep historical and cultural significance, drawing both the faithful and curious visitors alike.

The Neo-Gothic architecture is striking—tall spires, intricate stained-glass windows, and pointed arches that instantly transport you to another era. The central statue of Mother Mary, seen in the image beautifully adorned in traditional Indian-style robes, radiates grace and serenity. This fusion of local devotion and European design gives the basilica a unique charm.

Despite being located in a bustling area, the church complex remains remarkably peaceful, offering a sacred escape from the noise of the city. The atmosphere is calm and reverent, especially during evening services or quiet weekday visits. You can sit in silence, light a candle, or simply take in the sense of holiness that surrounds the space.

The annual St. Mary’s Feast in September is a major event, drawing thousands for its vibrant celebrations, but on regular days, the church maintains its gentle, spiritual aura.

Whether you're religious or not, St. Mary’s Basilica is a must-visit for its historical richness, stunning architecture, and the profound sense of peace it offers.

St. Mary’s Basilica is truly a serene and spiritual place in the heart of Bengaluru. The architecture is breathtaking with its beautiful stained-glass windows and tall spires that give it a peaceful charm. Inside, the atmosphere is calm and prayerful, offering a perfect space for reflection. The church is also well-maintained, and the annual St. Mary’s Feast in September is a sight to experience with its vibrant decorations and devotion. Whether you’re visiting for faith, history, or just some quiet time, this Basilica is definitely worth a visit.
This is a catholic church with latin masses. It is situated in a busy place. The highlight is the prayer space with the big statue of mother Mary. One can spend some quality time praying.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium, located in Central Bangalore, is a renowned destination offering captivating shows in Kannada and English. The planetarium, established in 1989 and named after India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, provides an immersive educational experience for visitors of all ages. Surrounded by lush greenery, the planetarium offers public lectures and workshops led by prominent astronomers and scientists on various intriguing topics related to space and astronomy.
placeMetadata.address: Sri T, Sankey Rd, High Grounds, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText: Visited the planetarium with a group of students and had a superb experience! The sky theatre show was both educational and engaging—perfectly suited for young learners. The staff were friendly and managed the crowd well. The interactive science park outside was a big hit with the students. A great place to spark curiosity about space and science. Highly recommended for school trips and curious minds!

A wonderful destination for anyone curious about the mysteries of space and astronomy. The shows are both educational and engaging, explaining complex concepts in a way that’s easy for all age groups to understand. The 3D sky projections and visuals make the experience truly immersive, and the narration keeps you hooked from start to finish. The place is well-maintained, with informative exhibits about planets, satellites, and India’s achievements in space research. A perfect spot for students, families, and science enthusiasts to explore the wonders of the universe.

A Trip to the Stars: Bangalore Planetarium for Kids!
Hey young explorers! Have you ever looked up at the night sky and wondered about the twinkling stars, the bright moon, or even faraway planets? Well, the Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium in Bangalore is the perfect place to learn all about them!
Imagine stepping into a giant dome where the ceiling becomes a magical sky. You'll sit back in comfy chairs and watch incredible shows that take you on a journey through space. You'll see planets like Jupiter and Saturn up close, zoom past distant galaxies, and even learn about brave astronauts who travel to the moon.
The shows are super fun and easy to understand, with cool pictures and exciting stories about our universe. It's like watching a giant movie about space, but way more exciting because you're right in the middle of it! You'll also learn about different stars, constellations, and maybe even discover your favorite planet.
It's a fantastic place for kids who love science and want to know more about the amazing cosmos we live in. Get ready to be amazed and feel like you've actually flown to the stars!
Note:- not a well maintained science park
2:-  no neatness in the lawn area or ticket counter

1. Shows last around 40 minutes; kids and adults enjoy the visuals despite some dated content.

2. Two short films per slot: e.g. “Our Solar System” and “Exploring the Universe.”

3. Dome seating (~210 people) with immersive recliners under a 15 m hemispherical screen.

4. Located in High Grounds, it’s easy to reach (near Cubbon Park metro).

5. Entry is Rs.100

6. Booking is available at the counter show tickets 1 hrs ahead.

7. Sky Theatre daily shows at ~3 :30 PM & 4:30 PM in English and Kannada.

8. Admission includes free access to the science centre & interactive science park.

9. Observatory with 6-inch refractor telescope for occasional star‑gazing events.

10. Closed on Mondays (and second Tuesdays), open ~10:30 AM–5:00 PM.

We recently visited the Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium in Bengaluru, and it turned out to be a delightful and educational experience, especially for kids who are curious about space and science. We attended the “Our Solar System” show at the sky theatre, which was both engaging and informative. The visuals were well-designed and the narration was clear, making it easy for children to grasp complex astronomical concepts in an enjoyable way. It truly sparked excitement and interest among the kids, who were thrilled to learn more about planets, moons, and the wonders of our solar system.

Apart from the show, we also explored the Science Park located in the outdoor area of the planetarium. While the concept of the park is excellent—with interactive science exhibits meant to inspire hands-on learning—it clearly shows signs of aging. Many of the exhibits are worn out or non-functional, and the entire space could benefit from better maintenance and refurbishment. Some parts looked neglected, and this takes away from the otherwise educational intent of the park.

Overall, the visit to the planetarium was very enjoyable and is certainly recommended for families with children, especially those who show an early interest in space and science. However, upgrading the science park and giving it a fresh look would definitely enhance the overall experience.
