🦋 Honest Review for Butterfly Park (Bannerghatta)
⭐⭐⭐☆☆ (3 out of 5 stars)

The Butterfly Park at Bannerghatta has great potential—and I truly wanted to love it. To be fair, the place is well-maintained, clean, and has a beautiful natural setup that sets the right mood for what could be a magical experience. 🌿✨

However, the experience felt somewhat underwhelming. For a butterfly park, the number and variety of butterflies were quite limited. More importantly, there was a lack of information and engagement. There’s no one explaining the fascinating life cycle of butterflies, their conservation, or even the species present in the park.

There was just one curator, who was friendly and approachable, but unfortunately, not very knowledgeable or prepared to interact deeply with visitors. Having seen butterfly parks around the world, I can confidently say that the curators usually bring the space to life—with their stories, passion, and insights. That was clearly missing here.

If they could invest in a few well-informed and engaging guides or curators, this place would soar in value and visitor satisfaction. Until then, I'm being generous with 3 stars—because I do want to encourage the effort and cleanliness, but it's still a stretch from what this place could and should be.

Verdict: Great idea, decent upkeep, but needs much more heart and expertise to truly flutter. 🦋

Peaceful Nature Escape with Room for Improvement

Butterfly Park at Bannerghatta is a wonderful little escape into nature, especially for families, nature lovers, and anyone looking to enjoy a serene and educational experience. Tucked inside the Bannerghatta Biological Park, the butterfly conservatory offers a peaceful retreat from the city buzz, with a large, dome-shaped enclosure filled with lush greenery, flowering plants, and—of course—butterflies.

The best part is walking through the conservatory and spotting different species fluttering around. It’s quite magical, especially for children. There’s also an informative exhibition hall and a short video presentation that explain the lifecycle of butterflies and their importance to the ecosystem. The displays are engaging and provide a nice educational touch without feeling overwhelming.

The facilities are generally well-maintained, and the staff is polite and helpful. The pathways are clean and accessible, and there's a small souvenir shop outside selling butterfly-themed merchandise.

However, there are a few areas where the experience could be improved. The butterfly dome could use a little more upkeep—some sections looked a bit worn, and we noticed fewer butterflies than expected, possibly due to seasonal changes or maintenance issues. Also, signage inside the park could be clearer for first-time visitors, especially when navigating from the main zoo entrance to the Butterfly Park.

Overall, it’s a lovely half-day outing that blends learning with leisure. I’d recommend visiting early in the day to avoid crowds and get the best chance to see active butterflies. Definitely worth a visit if you're in or around Bengaluru and want to enjoy a calm, nature-based experience!

It features DJ music and a diverse Asian menu, including dishes like Spicy celery prawns, Vietnamese style spicy fish, and Rock shrimp tempura with spicy mayo. The lounge is known for its top-class service and special offerings for couples.
placeMetadata.address: 26/1, Rooftop, World Trade Center, Dr Rajkumar Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560055, India

reviews.reviewText: High ultra launch is one of the favourite place of mine in Bangalore. It is located on the 32nd floor. High altitude building. Especially when there is raining, please do visit this place. I recommend couples to spend some time here. It is better to start your journey after 7 o’clock to enjoy the Best night view. The wind will be blowing all over your body. I visited this during Diwali and I could see. It was slightly raining and at the same time I could see rockets bursting out here and there around this cafe and it was such a beautiful view. Please do watch the video. Note that price is quite expensive, just to have a burger or a pizza, you have to spend a lot. But it is worth it.

A Perfect Spot for Rooftop Lovers Like Me!
High Ultra Lounge had been catching my eye for a while, and I finally got to experience it on a Thursday night. We booked a table via Zomato and got 50% off on the bill such a great deal!

We came from HSR, about an hour’s drive, and reached around 9 PM. The weather was windy and cold, but thankfully it wasn’t too crowded. We got a table with a stunning view absolutely magical!

There are three sections: two open-air and one indoor with a bar and DJ. We tried the pizza and another dish were really good. The staff were a bit busy and it took around 15–20 minutes for the food to arrive, but they were extremely friendly and super helpful especially when it came to taking photos! They patiently helped us capture some amazing shots, which made the experience even more memorable.

Now, let’s talk about the view, it’s mind-blowing. The whole city lights up beneath you, and if you love heights like I do, this place feels like a dream. Even the transparent elevator ride up is exciting you can see the city rise below you as you go higher.

A few tips:
•	They’re open till 1 AM, but food orders close around 12 midnight.
•	There’s free parking right opposite the World Trade Center building. You’ll need to walk a few meters, but the path has a fountain and a nice vibe a lovely little walk before you enter.

If you love high places, night lights, rooftop vibes, and taking lots of photos — High Ultra Lounge is a must-visit. Can’t wait to go again!

I dined here on a Sunday afternoon and the ambience and quality of service is good. Could always be better but I'm far from disappointed. Antony was my server and he was very warm, patient and sweet. Speaking about the food, it was above average. I'm critiquing above average considering what we are getting for what we are paying. The menu is slightly on the expensive side. However the quantity served depends on your food choices. Some might be good and some may not be. For me the quantity was sufficient. I had ordered small plates of edamame, black pepper crab gatin and Kung pao chicken. They all tasted good but were slightly greasier (except edamame) than expected. I also had ordered the pepperoni and chorizo pizza and korean tenderloin bulgogi for the mains and I must admit that the beef was so well cooked and the sauce was worth relishing. However, you may pass on the pizza. There are better places in Bangalore to find much better ones.

The prices here are as high as the building, but unfortunately, the service is nowhere close to matching that standard. If I could rate their service in the negatives, I would—but sadly, Google doesn’t allow that.

The waiters seemed more interested in staring at the female guests than actually doing their jobs. It took them over 20 minutes just to bring us the menu, and honestly, if we hadn’t asked, I doubt we would’ve gotten it at all.

We were here to celebrate a special occasion, but the experience was a huge letdown. The only saving grace was the food, which thankfully tasted good.

I genuinely hope the management invests in proper training for the staff—because right now, the waiters seem completely clueless about what they’re serving or how to treat guests with basic respect.

Located on the 31st floor of the World Trade Centre, the panoramic view of Bangalore was absolutely stunning—especially around sunset.The music was upbeat but not too loud, which made it easy to have a conversation.

The pizza was just palatable,nachos were good.

High Ultra Lounge honestly left me with mixed feelings. The only thing going for this place is the altitude and the view — it’s truly beautiful and perfect for photography. The ambience is stunning, and it’s definitely an Instagrammable spot if you’re looking to click some aesthetic pictures.

The service was good, and the staff was polite and prompt. The drinks were decent, nothing extraordinary but fairly okay. However, everything falls apart when it comes to the food.

I had high expectations, especially for something like crispy lotus stem, which I usually enjoy at other places. But here, it was terribly disappointing — soggy, bland, and completely lacking in flavor. And that pretty much sums up the rest of the food as well. Every dish we tried was below average or outright bad. There was nothing redeeming about the food experience, which is shocking for a place that looks so premium from the outside.

If you’re heading here just for the vibe and pictures, then it’s worth a short visit. But if you’re looking for a satisfying meal or a good dining experience, this place fails miserably. For the kind of pricing they have, the quality of food is unacceptable.

Definitely not visiting again for the food. Great view, bad taste.
Food was fairly decent but didn’t specifically like their mocktails. Service was quick and the ambiance could’ve been better. Good for one time visit for the experience.

Had a great time at Ultra High Lounge! The vibe is super chill with amazing rooftop views. We tried the Crumbed Fried Chicken, Thai Chilli Hot Basil Prawns, Murg Tikka Platter, and Chicken & Wild Mushroom Thyme Risotto—everything was delicious and well presented. The Hawaiian Coloda was refreshing and perfectly balanced. Great food, good music, and quick service. Definitely worth visiting!

placeMetadata.name: URU Brewpark

sources.snippet: The massive URU Brewpark, which is regarded as Bangalore's first-ever brew park with four parts - brewery, cafe, bistro, and Park that looks extraordinarily chic. The space having minimalistic decor is famous for organizing parties. It has a gin and barbeque section that offers chic spots for taking pictures.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: With minimalistic decor and chic spots, URU Brewpark is known for its gin and barbeque section, offering Instagrammable settings for every social chic. Crisp beer glass product shots and modern farmhouse decor details are the takeaways.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

placeMetadata.description: Chic, contemporary hangout with outdoor tables offering eclectic global fare & craft beers.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: URU Brewpark is a trendy and modern hangout spot with outdoor seating, offering a diverse range of global cuisine and craft beers. Nestled in lush green surroundings, this brew park covers 1.5 acres and features a restaurant designed like a greenhouse, along with an attached brewery. The venue provides ample outdoor seating for guests to savor their meals amidst nature's beauty.
placeMetadata.address: Maratt Estate, Bannerghatta Rd, Dollar Layout, Phase 4, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

reviews.reviewText:
So this place first of all I would like to say is not at all overhyped. Amazing ambience, amazing food servers are also super friendly and helpful and the brewery has limited, but really good options. You have to book your table prior because this place was packed and you can’t get a table easily if you have not booked it. Its must try this area.
Food was really really fresh ingredients they have used is all fresh whatever we ordered was totally up to the mark. I must try you in the area.

Hey everyone, you can now rejoice. This place doesn’t play loud music and actually serves good food. 🤩

We had a good time here minus a few downsides that otherwise would’ve made the place perfect.

As I mentioned, the food is actually good. It’s rare that you actually enjoy a meal and can confidently say that. Especially the pork belly. This is one of those places. Too bad one of the starters (a platter) arrived last. Why?

I’m not happy with the fact that you are forced to make an account to order. Why does everything need an account? We had some issues with this and this alone wasted a good 10 minutes. Stop this shit. Let us place the order as is if we wish to. But I can’t deny that they were pretty quick in serving our food (except for the platter).

And they also force the service charge BTW.

I enjoyed the beer options here. As suggested by others, two of us ordered the mango ale and it’s true, it is good. I myself ordered the German and Scottish one (whatever the actual name is, I forgot).

The whole place is in open air and it can get VERY chilly at night so careful with that. A couple mosquitoes but it is what it is.

I would recommend this place for friends and family. Not loud, good food, nice ambience, and actually decent music. Not all the Hindi hits that are simply annoying (my opinion).

Nice place to chill with friends. They have different sitting options available - AC and non AC.

The thai salad was delicious, and cheesecake was good too. The berry compote can be made nicer.
The beer taste was not good. Service was okay, you have to keep looking for staff, so that you can place an, order it was not the time when it was crowded so I expect better service when the crowd is less but that was not the case.

Uru – The Restro Bar truly impressed me with its sheer scale and vibrant atmosphere. The place is massive, easily accommodating around 100 people, and it’s pet-friendly too – a cute cat even came up to us, making the evening even more delightful. The ambience was top-notch, offering the perfect setting to unwind with friends.

The food was absolutely exceptional – some of the best I’ve had in Bangalore. Their pizza ranks second only to The Pizza Bakery in my experience, and everything from the pasta to the lasagna was authentic and packed with flavor. Service was prompt and courteous throughout our visit.

There’s ample car parking available, which adds to the convenience. However, the only downside was being compelled to pay a service charge, which, as per norms, should be optional.

I recently visited URU Brewpark in JP Nagar on a Sunday, and the experience was fantastic from start to finish!

Booking and check-in were super easy, thanks to EazyDiner. The seating was well-organized, and even though it was a busy day, we were accommodated smoothly.

Loved how tech-friendly the place is—you can scan a QR code to view the menu and place orders hassle-free. There’s also an option to request songs by scanning another QR, which really adds to the vibe!

The beer options are excellent, with a variety of flavors and add-ons to suit different palates. The ambience is top-notch, spacious and relaxing, making it a great spot to hang out with friends or family.

One of the highlights was watching the IPL on the big screen, which created a lively, stadium-like atmosphere.

The desserts were a surprise delight—especially the mango-flavored ones, which were absolutely delicious! They also offer DSLR photo sessions for just ₹150, perfect for capturing memories in style.

Overall, a must-visit for anyone looking to unwind with great food, drinks, and vibes in Bangalore.

The place is quite famous in the young people circles. We ordered pizzas and pastas with mocktails. Everything was nice and tasty. Service was amazing. They have very clean restrooms, which Is very important - at least for me.
I would recommend this place to one and all. I even read they provide food for Vegans which is good as Veganism has come up as a growing market in Bengaluru and other cities across India.

It's a good place to chill out and the ambience is too good,the staff members were very responsive. One drawback is few tables outside are dirty leafs,seeds will be on the table tried there veg nachos which was ok ok , chicken 65 uru special ,corn masala was good and pizza which was sour and pale .

Uru is such a versatile and refreshing spot—perfect for both casual hangouts and special occasions. Whether you’re catching up with friends or celebrating something, the space adapts to both moods effortlessly. It’s spacious, green, and has a really relaxed yet lively atmosphere.

The open-air setup surrounded by trees and ambient lighting gives it a cozy yet vibrant feel, especially in the evenings. It’s definitely a great place to just sit back, enjoy your food or drinks, and soak in the vibe.

placeMetadata.name: Government Museum

sources.snippet: Then Government Museum is THE place for you to snap some relaxed pictures with the gorgeous flowers blooming in the garden surrounding it. This great red building is a no-miss if you love capturing intricate sculptures and vibrant paintings. Where | Government Museum - Kasturba Road, Ambedkar Veedhi, Sampangi Rama Nagar
sources.shortName: 9 Picturesque Spots In Bangalore That Are Every Photographer's Delight

sources.snippet: The museum houses rare collections, which represent various periods. The 18 galleries in the museum have antique jewellery, Neolithic finds of various civilizations and so on. You will find amazing sculptures and old paintings here.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places To Visit In Bangalore (Bengaluru)

placeMetadata.description: History museum displaying carvings, archeology & weaponry since 1877 in a historic red building.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Government Museum, located in Bangalore and established in 1865, is one of India's oldest and most popular museums. It attracts over 90,000 visitors annually. The museum features a historic red building and encompasses 18 galleries showcasing a wide array of artifacts including carvings, weaponry, sculptures, textiles, jewelry, coins, inscriptions and paintings dating back to ancient kingdoms such as Tanjore, Deccan and Mysore.
placeMetadata.address: Venkatappa Art Gallery Building, Kasturba Rd, Ambedkar Veedhi, Sampangi Rama Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText:
An historic landmark of Bangalore, the heritage of Karnataka. It's one of the oldest museum.

The museum have a good collection of artifacts, archeological finds, sculptures, paintings, ancient guns and swords and stone carvings.

There's an entry fees of approx 20rs per person for the entry. And parking facilities are available.

Also there's small snacks shops available near the gate for refreshing.

Government Museum, Bangalore, established in 1865 by the Mysore State with the guidance of Surgeon Edward Balfour who founded the museum in Madras and supported by the Chief Commissioner of Mysore, L.B. Bowring, is one of the oldest museums in India and the second oldest museum in South India. It is now an archaeological museum and has a rare collection of archaeological and geological artifacts including old jewellery, sculpture, coins and inscriptions. The museum is also home to the Halmidi inscription, the earliest Kannada inscription (450 AD).

GOVT MEUSIUM, BANGLORE,KASTURBA ROAD was Under renovation
Photos from newly constructed hebber gallary in the same compoud entry 50 rupees.

The Government Museum in Bangalore showcases breathtaking architecture that leaves a lasting impression. While currently temporarily closed. The exterior alone is a testament to the city's rich cultural heritage, promising a fascinating experience for art and history enthusiasts.

**Government Museum (Venkatappa Art Gallery), Bangalore:**

1. **Artistic Treasure Trove:**
The museum houses a diverse collection of artifacts, sculptures, and paintings. The Venkatappa Art Gallery is particularly known for its impressive display of artworks by K. Venkatappa and other renowned artists. The range of exhibits provides visitors with a comprehensive view of India's artistic heritage.

2. **Venkatappa's Legacy:**
K. Venkatappa, a prominent artist, was instrumental in establishing the art gallery. His works, including landscapes, portraits, and historical paintings, are showcased, offering a glimpse into the evolution of Indian art during the early 20th century.

3. **Sculptures and Artefacts:**
The museum features a notable collection of sculptures, artifacts, and archaeological finds. These exhibits span different periods of Indian history, providing an educational experience for those interested in the country's rich cultural heritage.

4. **Architectural Charm:**
The architecture of the museum adds to the overall experience. The building itself is a historical landmark, contributing to the city's architectural heritage. The design and layout enhance the viewing of artworks and artifacts.

5. **Educational Value:**
The museum serves as an educational resource for schools and art enthusiasts. Regular workshops, guided tours, and lectures contribute to the dissemination of knowledge about art and culture. It is a valuable destination for students and researchers alike.

6. **Temporary Exhibitions:**
The museum often hosts temporary exhibitions, featuring contemporary artworks and thematic displays. These rotating exhibits keep the museum dynamic and offer something new for repeat visitors.

7. **Accessibility and Location:**
Situated in the heart of Bangalore, the museum is easily accessible. Its central location makes it a convenient stop for both locals and tourists exploring the city.

8. **Conservation Efforts:**
Preserving the artworks and maintaining the museum's infrastructure are crucial aspects. Adequate conservation efforts ensure that the exhibits remain in good condition for future generations to appreciate.

9. **Cafeteria and Amenities:**
Some museums include amenities like cafeterias or gift shops. These facilities can enhance the overall visitor experience by providing a place to relax and reflect on the exhibits.

10. **Visitor Experience:**
The overall visitor experience depends on personal interests, but those passionate about art, history, and culture often find the Government Museum (Venkatappa Art Gallery) in Bangalore to be a rewarding destination.

It's a great place, there are two museums next to each other, the science and historic museum. This is the historic one.
The entry fee is ₹20 for adults and ₹10 for kids as on Feb 2021 and there is ample parking space.
It was a nice time to see so many ancient things, the sulptures and paintings etc. It's a must visit place if you enjoy historical museums.

Impressive quaint red heritage building on Kasturba Road more than 150 years old. If you love art, history  and heritage this is a must visit. With the Rs 20 entry ticket one can also visit the art collection having amongst others some find Ten more paintings and wooden sculptures at Venkatappa Art gallery which is in the same premises and one leads to another. Archaeological findings comprising of pottery, sculptures, armaments, coins and scriptures dating back to Neolithic age can be found at the museum. Some amazing sculptures of prehistoric times well preserved makes it a must visit when coming to Bangalore for a visit. Good for children too to make them aware of our rich history and culture. Open from 10 am to 5 pm

Government Musem, Bengaluru, Karnataka is the Official Government Museum which is situated adjacent to Visvesvaraya industrial and technological museum in Bengaluru. This museum is established in 1865 and now this museum is one of the most oldest museums which are still operating in India and second most oldest museum in South India.
In 1877, the New building was constructed and Opened.
From that time, that same building is still operating as one of the most finest archaeological museums in India.
It is now an archaeological museum and has a rare collection of archaeological and geological artifacts including old jewellery, sculpture, coins and inscriptions. The museum is also home to the Halmidi inscription,the earliest Kannada inscription (450 AD).
As this museum is almost in the City centre and very near to Visvesvaraya museum and many other main attractions of the Cit, the annual visitors will cross 1 Lakh in Number from Various parts of the Country and even from other Countries also.
This museum is very rich in showcasing our culture heritage and history via its preserved items as they are the remaining evidences of our History.
So if you are planning a trip to Bengaluru, please visit this Government Museum also.

placeMetadata.name: Courtyard

sources.snippet: The Courtyard House is a dream location to conduct your photoshoot. The location has various high-roofed rooms which are elegantly decorated. All these rooms are arranged in a circular pattern, and the open space between the circles forms the central courtyard.
sources.shortName: Top Photoshoot places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: The Courtyard House is a fantastic place to do your picture session. Several luxuriously furnished rooms with high ceilings can be found at this site. The rooms are set up in concentric rings, with the open area in the middle serving as a courtyard.
sources.shortName: List of best places for photoshoot in Bangalore, Karnataka

placeMetadata.address: 105, Kengal Hanumanthaiah Rd, opp. Corporation Bank, Raja Ram Mohanroy Extension, Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027, India

reviews.reviewText:
Went for Beyond bangla by Chef Auroni Mookherjee. Outstanding epecurian experience. His rendition of popular Bengali favourites like the seafood dabchigri, the lamb ravioli in mangsho jhol style and tangra style ramen were outstanding! Tried the kachagolla with spice honey for dessert - divine

Thank you Chef Auroni, Chef Anushka & team !!

The food and service was good. Liked the harissa chicken sandwich, and the veg grilled sandwich. The South Indian filter coffee with jaggery syrup was also good.

What I find very odd is the parking charges of 200 bucks - esp when the car is parked right in front of their property. This is quite bizarre when the valet parks the car either in front or in their basement.

I’d say it’s a Small yet a sophisticated space.
Had a good time watching the sangeeth scene there.
The mood was totally poetic with the rain, traditional music and hot chocolate. We’ve entered when the music was playing and it slowly started drizzling. We sat there trying food from Ajji house while completely immersed in the music

So we went for the ‘Movie night under the stars’ in Courtyard. The ambience and set up is good- the concept and them is good too. However the event as such wasn’t to the expectation. We were given headphones to watch the movie, however there were some external noises, the set up was not exclusively for the event, they had the bar open for others beside the event which was a distraction in a way. There obviously was no STARS view being in the city centre and it was quite humid. The projector or the picture quality was also compromised. 3 course meals were served but I feel they could have given better options to chose the food to our palate. It’s nice one time experience provided you go with zero expectations
They have Subko and Naru, both are awesome. Even the exhibitions they have are amazing!

One of the best experiences I have had in Bangalore! I went for the movie under the stars night. The 3 course meal was simply divine. Very well organised event. There’s also a lot to do in the Courtyard - the Subko coffee shop, Naru, Wine in Progress are all in that one compound which was very cool. Lots to do in one space.

I went to attend a tuber luncheon at the courtyard and have observed several other events at this location.  The space is beautifully maintained and the ambience is calm and joyous. Perfect venue for any gathering.

We have also been here to attend some pop up events in the conservatory. It is a beautiful place with a great ambiance.  Both the times, we got to taste some really unique and good food.  I enjoy their curation and I wish they have more such pop up events with vegan options.

My only concern is the 100 rupee charge for valet parking.  Given that the events are all priced, this can be exempted and can be made a part of the pricing.

Can never go wrong with this one. Whether it is subko, wip or the naru starters you manage to get outside in the courtyard, all the food is amazing. We had six different wines at wip and all were fantastic, served at great temperatures. The Lillet Spritzer at wip is the bomb! Sunday night done right.

placeMetadata.name: Kazé Bar & Kitchen

sources.snippet: Kaze, the highest restaurant and bar in the city, offers panoramic views of Bangalore’s scenic beauty both day and night. It is worth visiting for its night skyline silhouettes and moody cocktail/food close-ups.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Kaze is the highest restaurant and bar in the city and the perfect spot to catch the scenic beauty of Bangalore during the day and night.
sources.shortName: Our Favourite Instagrammable Spots In Bangalore

placeMetadata.description: Sophisticated & opulent Pan Asian restaurant in the heart of town, with luxe surrounds.
placeMetadata.address: 21st Floor, SKAV, 909, Lavelle Road, near to Itc Gardenia, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Apart from the stunning view and delectable cuisine, the staff showed exceptional dedication to providing a memorable experience. Although the prices are somewhat on the higher end, the outstanding quality of the food and overall experience justifies the cost.
Highly recommend! 🫠

Rooftop inside air conditioned and outdoor sitting is with excellent view of the Bangalore Skyline.
All the vegetarian preparations was made with minimum spices and oil so that one can enjoy natural flavours food and vegetables. Jagath knows customers' preferences and helps them choose the right options.

Rooftop restaurant with a fabulous view of the city, this one is perfect for the cool summer evenings.
We went in the day time and it was still enjoyable.
We tried multiple items like salmon sushi, veg sushi roll, prawn tempura, chicken,  cheese rolls and fried rice and multiple mocktails.
The salmon sushi was refreshing and simply perfect. It was a highlight and so was the prawn tempura with light crispy batter.
The fried rice was subtle and so flavourful.
The drinks were good too.
Good amount of seating indoor and outdoor as well.

Kaze Bar & Kitchen totally impressed me. The rooftop vibe is on point — stylish, energetic, and perfect for a night out with friends or even a date. The menu has a cool mix of Asian and fusion dishes, and everything we ordered tasted amazing and looked great too.

The cocktails? Super creative and hit the spot. DJ live music was amazing — really brought the whole place to life and kept the energy high all night. Big shoutout to the staff — they were friendly, helpful, and knew their stuff when it came to the menu. Only slight downside was the service getting a little slow when it got crowded, but nothing major.

Overall, Kaze is definitely worth checking out if you're into great food, unique drinks, and a fun, lively atmosphere.

I had been hearing great things about this place, especially regarding the ambiance and food, so it was on my list to try. So far, I’ve visited twice, and it definitely lived up to the hype!

The ambiance is incredible, with beautifully done interiors that set the perfect mood. The service is top-notch—the staff is very helpful, friendly, and the manager is cooperative and understanding, ensuring a smooth experience.

If you're looking to party, Friday nights are ideal for a lively crowd, while Saturdays are also great but slightly less packed compared to Fridays. If you prefer a quieter experience, it's a good idea to reserve a table at Kaze to sit, eat, or chat, though I personally prefer the bar table.

I highly recommend the prawn tempura and chicken dumplings with chestnuts—they’re both exceptional. For drinks, Kiku is a must-try—it's fancy and fun. Plus, the place is budget-friendly, which is a bonus.

The crowd here is fantastic, making it a perfect spot to hang out.

Booked this place for an evening with a friend. Service was really good and sweet waitress. But we were quite unsure what she was saying because of accent barrier.
Spicy chicken dumplings were so good and well presented.
Prawns served on lemon grass skewers were too flavourful and tasty. I definitely suggest this dish.
Panko fried chicken was crispy but felt a bit too oily.
Then finally we ordered their signature mochi ice cream which was so so good. A thin layer of rice sheet and inside is the berry ice cream. This was so worth the price 400₹ for 3 scoops. Alcohol served here is a bit overpriced. The cocktail i ordered was bitter and not skillfully mixed. We also had suntory toki which hiked up the bill. But we had 30% off as we booked through zepto.

I had heard great reviews about Kazé and it lived up to the expectations. The rooftop view from 21st floor was amazing. The dimsums tasted great. Drinks presentation was impeccable. Staff was really courteous. Yes, the food is a bit pricey but for the quality of service you get it is totally worth it. Will definitely be coming back.

Limited roof top space for the crowd they allow in the weekends!

It’s sultry in summers…
DJ is okish
Actually I could play better…😄😊

placeMetadata.name: Dyu Art Cafe

sources.snippet: A Kerala-styled house turned cafe, the DYU art cafe in a tranquil 7th block Koramangla is both aesthetic pinnacle and a comfort zone. Catch many a tete-a-tetes at this cosy cafe surrounded by greenery while you savour a chocolate pancake or a salad. Just outside the DYU art cafe is a 100 meter stretch of graffiti walls which too make for some great photo shoots.
sources.shortName: Best Place For A Photo Shoot In Bangalore And Around (50+)
Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

placeMetadata.description: Cafe & gallery serving global dishes in a calm, rustic space with wood paneling & colourful artwork.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Dyu Art Cafe is a charming blend of a cafe and art gallery located in Bangalore. Housed in an old bungalow with open courtyards and gabled roofs, it offers a serene and rustic ambiance adorned with colorful artwork. The menu features global dishes, including English breakfast, sweet treats like the signature chocolate cake and banoffee pie, as well as coffee brews. Patrons rave about the homemade banoffee pie, cafe mocha, and cold coffee.
placeMetadata.address: Dyu art cafe No 23, KHB MIG Colony, Koramangala 8th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

reviews.reviewText:
This restaurant offers a beautiful and serene dining experience, making you feel like you’re enjoying a meal in a treehouse. The ambiance is peaceful, and the setting is perfect for a relaxed meal.

The menu has a good variety of options at an affordable price. We ordered a filter coffee (₹120), a cold frappe (₹230), and a spicy lamb pizza (₹400). The pizza was tasty, though it had a thin crust—great for one person with a big appetite or two with a moderate one.

Service was quick, and the staff was friendly and attentive. On average, a meal for two would cost around ₹700-₹800, making it a great value for the experience.

Overall, it was a great experience, and I’d definitely visit again!

We visited this place on Saturday at 7:00 p.m. It was already quite crowded, and we had to wait for around 40 minutes to get a table. The waiting lobby was impressive, with proper chairs, tables, and even a swing-shaped chair. The café ambiance was aesthetic and cozy, perfect for hanging out.

Here’s what we ordered:

Hot Chocolate – ₹190
Warm and comforting. The taste was good.

Half Veg Half Non-Veg Pizza – ₹400
Thin crust with a pesto spread on the base. The veg portion was delicious, but the non-veg side didn’t taste great.

French Croquettes – ₹200
Mixed veggie fingers, served hot and very crispy. We really liked this.

Cappuccino – ₹270
Not up to the mark.

This is a cool, chill place to vibe with friends and snack on something tasty.
The customer service is top-notch. While seating may take some time on weekends, the wait is well worth it.
But the online ordering system is kinda weird. You place your order online, but then the waiter still has to come over to confirm it. Doesn't make sense.
Their menu is simple and direct.
The stuffed mushrooms were really good and the mushroom sandwich was simply amazing.
The pineapple lime juice was very refreshing.
Overall a great experience at this cafe and will definitely visit again.

It is an amazing cafe. Had a good time here with my friends. Ambience -5/5
Food -4/5
Service -5/5
For a peaceful and good atmosphere itself we can go and have food. Worth the money as well.
Prefer weekdays to avoid waiting time.

We are a group of friends who recently visited the Dyu art cafe. The place has very good vintage vibes. Food is good. It is very near to nexus mall, Koramangala. But it is crowded so they have waiting time. At the entrance you need to give your name and they will be assigned a table. Service can be improvised as it is a bit crowded. Overall it is good place to hangout with friends or family. Also you can work there as well.

The smoothies were really good. The veg lasagna was absolutely yum and totally worth ordering. Unfortunately, the pancake was not fluffy and definitely not something I’d recommend. The barbecue pizza was just average, nothing special. The staff was polite and attentive.
Just a note for first-timers — you might have to wait around 30 minutes to get a table on weekends!!!

Food wise very average place, vibe wise it’s good. Place has nice woody and beach sack type vibes, but not a comfortable one. The lighting in the normal noon time is dim, which should be something to improve. Comes to food, nothing out of ordinary here, some even below par. Not a place would worth visiting twice

The hotel is beautifully maintained in a traditional style — it truly feels like stepping into a 100-year-old Kerala heritage home. Everything is well-organized and thoughtfully kept. The food menu was also nice, offering a good variety of dishes that complemented the overall experience.

placeMetadata.name: The Rogue Elephant

sources.snippet: Another charming villa turned cafe, the Rogue Elephant Cafe in Basavangudi with its colorful walls, doors, and other curios, is great for a day time shoot.
sources.shortName: Best Place For A Photo Shoot In Bangalore And Around (50+)
Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

placeMetadata.description: Open-air cafe in a garden, with colorful seating, a lively vibe & Continental food.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Rogue Elephant is a charming open-air cafe nestled in the City of Gardens, offering a vibrant atmosphere and delectable Continental cuisine. The garden restaurant boasts colorful seating and serves up mouthwatering sandwiches, salads, fruit pannacotta, and pasta. Guests rave about the Zucchini Fritters and hummus while sipping on freshly-made Ice Tea. The nostalgic 90s ambiance adds to the cozy feel of this old-gold establishment where everyone feels at home.
placeMetadata.address: 93, Kanakapura Main Rd, Mohammedan Block, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India

reviews.reviewText:
This has been my go to place for the last 10 years (for real, just that I’ve never left a review for some reason). I may be biased but this is probably the best place to eat out in this area and the garden ambience really adds to a relaxing day out if you’re planning one. Great place to eat out by yourself and have a nice, quiet day too.
The staff here are really the highlight. They are super polite and friendly.
As for the food - no bad item on the menu really. Everything feels freshly made and perfectly cooked/seasoned.

My favorite ones I’d recommend are the fig salad, ice tea, palak paneer and banana loaf.

The food is good. Service can be better. Ambience is kinda nice and relaxed. It's a little out of the way in a quiet part of Basavanagudi, so it's ideal for a lazy weekend lunch.

I've been there twice this year.

First time:
Iced Tea - Rs. 125
Potato Wedges - Rs. 245
Pan Fried Fish - Rs. 615

The Iced Tea wasn't very tea-ish, but the wedges and fish were great.

Second time:
Summer Cooler - Rs. 215
Alleppey Fish curry with rice - Rs. 685
Mushroom Toasties - Rs. 295

I liked all that was served. The fish curry had mango in it if I'm not mistaken. It was a special for the day, so not on the menu.

Most of the mains are in the 500-600 range, so not an economical restaurant so to speak, but the quality always meets expectations.

Recommended if you're ever in this neck of the woods.

Had an absolutely healthy lunch at Elephant Rouge, Jayanagar! The ambience was calm and tastefully done, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed meal. The food was the real star — the salad was flavorful, well-balanced, and beautifully presented.

I tried their signature salad, The Mango Avocado & Almond Salad and the Summer Cooler. The salad stood out with its freshness and unique twist on classic flavours. The staff were polite, attentive, and made sure we had a smooth dining experience.

Special mention to the presentation and portion sizes — generous without being overwhelming. Whether you’re looking for a casual lunch or a special meal with friends or family, Elephant Rouge hits the mark. Definitely coming back soon!

Very rarely do I give a 5 star rating! Too bad there isn’t something bigger.

I came down with my niece and my sister to enjoy a slow afternoon and some bites. It was so
Worth it.

We ordered the following:
Hummus and pita (yes the bread was warm)
Penne with basil pesto
Watermelon salad with cheese (perfectly seasoned)
Avocado mango salad (muah)
Mushrooms in wine sauce with bread

The portions are perfect and the presentation is very good. The atmosphere is fantastic. Banashankari rocks even now!

Make sure you talk to the owner. He takes pride in what he does!

Bringing my Mrs to this place next time as she would have been in heaven.

The price is disproportionate to the quality and taste of the food. I used to love this place so much but now every single dish was bad. Sent back two dishes. For charging over ₹600 on a  single dish of veg main course it tastes worse than what you eat roadside. Having food here ruined my day and my appetite.

This place is a hidden gem of Basavanagudi.

They have something called - soup of the day.

The soup was American Corn sweet soup. This was made perfectly with less salt and spice.

The hummus with chicken and pita was just too good. A must try food.

Their mutton curry with seasoned rice, something that I tell - heavenly.

In the end, I ordered a banana walnut cake, they serve it warm with butter, which is just too delicious and yummy.

An amazing place to visit again and again.

The Rogue Elephant in Basavanagudi, Bangalore, is a charming open-air restaurant offering a serene, garden-like dining experience.
Located at 93, Kanakapura Road, next to New Generation School, it’s known for its Italian, Mediterranean, and Continental dishes with Indian fusion flair.

Set under a 100-year-old tree with wooden tables and antiques, it captures old-Bangalore nostalgia, perfect for relaxed brunches or dinners.
The staff is attentive, and owner Anand Chettur ensures a warm experience.
Open daily from 11:30 AM to 9:00 PM, it’s pricier (~₹1000 for two) but praised for generous portions.
A true gem near Gandhi bazar and Bull Temple!

This is one of the underrated restaurant in this area.
The ambiance is really good! It is semi open space.
They have different styles of seating as well! And ample space between two seatings so it's not filled with people.

The food is really good! (I have tried only vegetarian options). I really liked mango avacado almond salad! The banana cake is awesome! It's freshly made and you can feel the warmth!
With that they give butter and the combo is really amazing! It is not too sweet! Yet feels like awesome dessert.
I have tried their sandwich, it's pretty good as well.
The pricing is a bit on the higher side!
But you are planning for fancy food, you can go for it. Also the place is a bit fancy as well, a perfect place for date as well,

placeMetadata.name: The Bohemian House

sources.snippet: TBH, which is a popular co-working space in Richmond Town, is actually a heritage bungalow. It is a creative co-working space covering 6000 sq. The Feet area in Bangalore is famous for creative events and meetings in a stylish, minimalistic environment.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Bangalore
Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Bohemian House, located in Richmond Town, Bangalore, is a heritage bungalow transformed into a creative co-working space spanning 6000 sq. feet. It's known for hosting stylish and minimalistic creative events and meetings. This popular spot provides a supportive environment for bloggers, entrepreneurs, and artists. The venue offers co-working spaces, a restaurant, and open areas for various activities. Additionally, it regularly hosts impressive conferences and other events that are worth checking out.
placeMetadata.address: Raja Ram Mohan Roy Rd, Inside Hotel, Woody's, Richmond Town, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

reviews.reviewText:
A beautiful place to relax and unwind. We visited the new Third Wave cafe that has recently opened up here and it was amazing. The cappuccino and the cold coffee were great. We even ordered a Mediterranean sandwich, which was delicious and much larger in portion size than what we expected.
The cafe was super peaceful with a zen kind of vibe to it.
After sunset, a lot of beautiful lights also lit up in the open air seating area inside. That made the place even more picturesque. Overall, a wonderful experience. Definitely visiting again!

Indest community had an event there for which I went to the venue. The place was absolutely breathtaking. Co-working, restaurant, open space. Bohemian house is a package. Can't comment on the restaurant price but the place is worth checking out. It also keep hosting super cool conference and all.

A cozy, yet a beautifully restored vintage space this place is - The Bohemian House. A mix of co-working, cafe and an events place, this is a nest for the creative souls.

Their activities are off beat and great, the activity space too is not very expensive and the best part of that it is accessible to a lot of people as it's in the central business district of Bengaluru.

The aura, the ambience and the people will make you fall in love with this place... So just find an excuse and land in here, you will not regret the decision!

One of the most beautiful properties I've been to in Bangalore. Such a great space for artists and also, for events.
They have good coffee as well!

Visited The Bohemian House a couple of weeks for an organizational planning meeting with some of my colleagues. Before going into any further details, want to confess that I was awestruck with the beauty of the place. From the moment we reached the place, the next couple of minutes were speechless internalizing the decor and artistic look & feel of the place. The place is huge with lot of space, both indoors and outdoors. Though every nook and corner of the place is treat for the eyes, I particularly like the veranda (backyard) of sorts with ample sitting in the natural environs.

We were allotted a beautiful room for ourselves, with an artistic grandeur, couple of chairs and tables, bar stools, a television screen with projector capability and a tea / coffee vending machine. To add to the experience, was a delightful service provided by none other than Marzipan Cafe, which needs no introductions.

The day was spent planning & brainstorming with colleagues, accompanied with yummy delights from Marzipan. There was no stop put to the yummy Cappuccinos, Lattes & Americanos, accompanied with the out-of-world freshly baked cookies. If you do, don't forget to try their melt-in-the-mouth Ragi cookie - which is beyond anyone's comprehension. We also tried other bakery items that were on display, like the Puffs, Tyropita & Quiche. We also ordered a Mushroom Melt Sandwich, which again was worth the try, amazingly fresh & delicious. The desserts at Marzipan are the showstoppers and are not to be missed at any cost, particularly the Marzipan Cake, Banoffee Pie & Banana Nutella Cake.

Do visit the place & guaranteed that you will fall in love with it !

A hidden but central place that looks especially beautiful in the evening with twinkling lights. There's even a mini waterfall of sorts and a hammock to relax  The only issue here would be all the mosquitos in the evening - it would be good if the management handled this somehow!

It's a co- working space.  Soothing and green ambience, lots of comfortable places to sit and work. Vintage interiors.They have in-house coffee shop and bakery. Friendly staff. Feels like you're in a resort. Loved it! 😉

The Bohemian House (TBH) is a labour of love, built from the ground up to cater to a community of creators. In 2017, Shalini Prasad and her mother Shashi Prasad came together to flesh out the first blueprints of what is now TBH. Based in Bangalore in the Central Business District, near Richmond Circle, TBH is housed inside the old Woodland's Hotel (Woody's). The physical structure is over 70 years old, and styled like an old Mysore Bungalow.

At TBH, you'll find a thoughtfully designed creative co-working space, with space for an intimate community of 65. The space also houses a Home Decor boutique  - The Pieces and a Cafe by Third Wave Coffee Roasters. Apart from this, TBH organizes regular community events, supporting a variety of arts, as well as gender based talks, parties and carnivals.

placeMetadata.name: Brigade Rd

sources.snippet: Brigade Road is one of Bangalore’s busiest shopping streets and a popular spot to hang out due to all the restaurants and bars in the area. It attracts a hip and young crowd, but you’ll find a mixture of everybody walking around here due to its center location. Designer clothing brands line the main street, while the side streets are filled with trendy pubs, cafes and more.
sources.shortName: City Street Guides by f.d. walker: A Street Photography Guide to Bangalore, India

sources.snippet: You must be wondering what one might do in Brigade road which is one of the busiest streets in Bangalore?. It is very well located at the heart of the city. The streets are always crowded.

Whether you like to shop, eat, walk around and explore, or relive your childhood, Film City has something special to offer you.

sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Bangalore | Top Tourist Attractions

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vels Innovative Film City, located in Bidali off the Bangalore-Mysore Highway, is a top entertainment destination offering a wide range of attractions for visitors of all ages. From Cartoon City and Aqua Kingdom to Dino Park and Mini Golf, there's something for everyone. The water park, Aqua Kingdom, is particularly popular during the summer months with its wave pool and lazy river rides providing relief from the heat.
placeMetadata.address: Chikkakuntanahalli, Karnataka 562109, India

reviews.reviewText:
A Perfect Destination for a Fun-Filled Day Near Bangalore

This attraction, located approximately 40 to 50 km from Bangalore (distance varies based on your location—please check maps for accuracy), is an excellent destination for a day of entertainment and adventure.

With ticket prices ranging between ₹850 to ₹1,050, the park offers a variety of rides and games suitable for all age groups. A key highlight is the Jurassic Park ride, which adds an exciting experience to the visit. Additionally, the wet park provides a refreshing escape, making it ideal for those who enjoy water-based attractions. The park generally operates from 10:45 AM to 7:00 PM, and visitors can enjoy unlimited rides, subject to availability.

In the evening, a live dance performance adds to the overall entertainment, creating a vibrant and engaging atmosphere. Families with children will find this destination particularly enjoyable.   There are many rides for kids and also there are game rooms for kids.

However, if you plan to visit the wet park, ensure you carry nylon swimwear, as entry to pools and water rides may be restricted otherwise.

There is laser show at the end in evening around 6:30-7
Overall, this park is a fantastic choice for a day of fun and relaxation, offering a well-rounded mix of adventure, entertainment, and leisure.

Good place for a day outing. Kids will enjoy the dinosaur world, 5d cinema ( needs some maintenance though), Wave pool and water park.  Value for money.  Few dry rides were closed for maintenance. The changing room needs were smelling awful and needed more house keeping attention. The food court has few decent options to fill your belly. . Overall good experience.

No proper maintenance,entry fee is 1500 each but inside again we have to pay extra for some games and don't have many games also.Totally waste of money and time... The only use is to take photos that's all.

Jollywood is a fun, diverse, one‑stop amusement experience—mixing cinema magic, adventure, water, and museums. Perfect for family outings where variety matters. It’s best enjoyed on a weekday, with early arrival and combo tickets. Just moderate expectations on food and some attractions.

Review of Jollywood bangalore

Our group of 15+ people, including children and ladies, booked tickets in advance online using the Buy 3 Get 1 Free offer. The booking process was smooth, and we were excited for our visit.

Arrival & Entry:

We arrived at the park at the opening time and were greeted with a welcome flash mob, which set an energetic tone for the day. Parking was ample and convenient, making the entry hassle-free.

Attractions & Rides:

Our adventure began with a 5D cinema experience, which was thrilling. This was followed by a bull ride , and a bouncy castle for the kids. However, the bouncy castle's slide was too steep, making it less enjoyable for younger children.

There are a few other small experiences like titanic , village theme etc

The Jollylucious segment stood out with its indoor play area, which was a delight for the little ones. Next, we explored the Dino Ride, ideal for kids aged 3-7 years, and its adjoining museum, which was informative.

We then moved on to the dry rides and water park area. The water slides had a maximum weight limit of 85-90 kg for three slides, but there were no restrictions for the rest, ensuring everyone could enjoy.

The Mirror Maze was another highlight, offering a fun and slightly challenging experience. However, we were disappointed that the wave pool was under maintenance, as it would have been a great addition to our day.

Food & Refreshments:

For lunch, we visited the food court, which had a wide variety of options catering to different tastes. The quality and variety were satisfying, making it a great pit stop before continuing our adventure.

For snacks we had some pop corn and choclates

Evening Entertainment & Conclusion:

As the day progressed, we enjoyed the stage dance performance, which added a lively touch to the experience. The park concluded the day with a colorful parade, making for a memorable ending.

Final Verdict:

The lack of crowds due to exam time meant no long wait times for rides, enhancing our overall experience. While a few aspects like the steep bouncy castle slide and the wave pool maintenance were minor letdowns, the park still delivered a fun-filled and enjoyable day.

Overall Rating: (4/5) A great spot for families and groups looking for a mix of adventure, entertainment, and relaxation!
A well maintained good place for kids who don't like too many games since thr r only limited games. The water park is good and neatly maintained. Visit on weekdays to avoid the crowd.
It was an amazing experience. It has everything for kids and adults fun. Waterpark diff. activities to enjoy, a complete fun destination for all.

A full day of entertainment it is.
An amazing place for kids and adults too

placeMetadata.name: Sly Granny, Forum Rex Walk

sources.snippet: The wallpaper made of Arnold Schwarzenegger and pineapples gives you an idea about the eccentricity of Sly Granny. All kinds of knick-knacks adorn the walls and the stairway that leads to the upstairs is lined up with mad, mad art. Oh, and come evenings, the upstairs section with its rooftop section gets all dreamy with twinkling lights.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots In The City

sources.snippet: Sly Granny’s eclectic decor, Arnold Schwarzenegger wallpaper, and twinkling rooftop lights make for effortlessly Instagrammable moments. Use playful cafe-themed portraits and quirky wall art as backdrops.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Places in Bangalore

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Sly Granny, located in the vibrant city of Bangalore, is a must-visit spot for food and drink enthusiasts. This charming venue offers a delightful twist on Southern comfort with its Biscuits and Gravy dish, featuring fluffy buttermilk biscuits paired with savory Italian pork sausage in a rich sage and bacon gravy—set to return to the menu soon!
placeMetadata.address: Forum Rex Walk, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Super swanky space with amazing music, ambience and food!
Loved the decor here and the old school club like seating inside the ac area as well as the cool cafe seating on the terrace.
The drinks are good. We especially loved the Posh G&T from their signature cocktails menu. Everything we tried from the god menu was good. Special mention for the tofu noodles. Also the caramel cheesecake.
Totally cool place to visit and hang out with friends or family. Great option for an evening date in the terrace space.

We visited this place for late lunch. The place had an aesthetic appearance, having seating both indoors and outdoors. It also had nice music playing in the background. We tried almost everything available on the vegetarian menu. Everything was delicious and quantity was sufficient. The service by the staff was also good. You must try their tacos which were lip smacking. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

The interiors were done really well and it was very Aesthetic. The pricing was a little too high compared to other restaurants serving similar food. But the food tasted good, it took some time to get some of the dishes but it was worth the wait.
Service was slightly slow and some of the drinks were not available.
Overall it was a memorable experience.

Average experience overall right from ordering to food to billing. Ambience is really good though, the only person who stands out is the lady at the entrance who escorts you inside.

Disappointing food and service is below average. The server didn't bother to refill the water, gave the bill and disappeared, fries had a burnt flavor, the pork ribs cooked well though were accompanied by an exceedingly sweet pineapple sauce which seems like a mistake, the cheese cake was average, chicken schnitzel tasted like store bought chicken nuggets.

Interiors are well done, full marks to whoever designed and executed them!
One of the Best Italian food in Bangalore. We ordered for 1 starter platter and 2 main course for 3 of us and it was filling. I found cafe biscoff dessert to be mouth watering, but held my taste buds

Bengaluru can never have a dearth of eateries you are looking for, be it a casual place or a premium one. Amidst a long list of premium restaurants, there is the newest addition where the opulent look is beautifully blended with vintage and vibrancy. Coming to food, this is one of the very few places where we were so fascinated with lip-smacking appetizers that we had zero bandwidth to even look for main course. They do fusion with global cuisine very uniquely and it makes you indulge irresistibly. If you are on a diet, think before you zero in this venue 😉

I went to banglore with my brother because of some business work and I recently dined at Sly Granny , and I wanted to share my thoughts on the experience. Overall, I had a positive experience at the restaurant.  The service was attentive and friendly throughout the meal. The service Guy named Risi helped me a lot and he was very friendly and I had a great meal which was fabulous and Tasty 😋 ...

I particularly enjoyed the variety of dishes on the menu. The food was flavorful and well-prepared. The Budha Bowl I ordered was a highlight; it was delicious and exceeded my expectations. I also enjoyed the delicious cocktail named Berry basil caipiroska..

However, there were a couple of areas where I would love to stay all day . The wait time for our food was Not so much late it was somehow quick , and it would be great if this could be reduced in the future. Additionally, the portion size of some dishes seemed a bit small for the price But it doesn't matters because the food taste was enough..

Despite these minor issues, I would definitely consider returning to Sly granny in the future. The overall dining experience was enjoyable, and I appreciate the effort put into creating a pleasant atmosphere and delicious food.

Thank you for providing a great dining experience, and I look forward to visiting again.

Let's eat @ Sly Granny today!" The ambience is as eclectic as the dishes. I recently had the pleasure of indulging in a gastronomic journey at this Bangalore gem, and let me tell you, it did not disappoint!

Starting with the drinks, I tried the Posh G&T, Fresh Lime Soda, Berry & Basil, and Caprioska, and each one was a refreshing and burst of flavor.

Moving on to the appetisers,We tried the Granny's House Salad, Mezze platter, Grilled Figs And Goat Cheese, and Yam Kulcha. The salad was fresh and crisp, the Mezze was a flavorful and colorful delight, the Grilled Figs And Goat Cheese can be improved and it was more of a breakfast dish than an appetiser and the Yam Kulcha was a unique take on the traditional Indian bread. We loved it and give it a whopping 10/10 for this dish.

For the main course, I had the Three Bean Taco and the Gnocchi, and both were fantastic. The Three Bean Taco was a flavor explosion in my mouth, with perfectly seasoned beans and a soft tortilla and I couldn't get enough of. The Gnocchi was pillowy and delicious, with a creamy sauce
.
And last but not least, the dessert. I indulged in the Dark Chocolate Truffle, and it was the perfect ending to an already amazing meal. Rich, decadent, and perfectly balanced. However I'm going back here to try the cheesecake as there was lots of ooooos and awwws from the neighbouring table !!!!
.
Overall, my experience at Sly Granny was fantastic. Giving it an overall 4/5 stars. The ambience was charming and eclectic, and the food was creative, flavorful, and expertly executed. I can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes!

Head here early in the morning if you want to get some photos around the time of sunrise.

reviews.reviewText: Had a lovely maternity shoot at BookMyCapture! The venue had beautiful themes that made every shot feel special. The team was supportive, and the whole experience was smooth and memorable. Grateful for the wonderful photos and the sweet memories we created. Highly recommend!

It's a good place for a photo/song shoot.
Make sure u carry eatables & stuff because u have to travel a little.
Restrooms are not so good.

I’m really impressed with BookMyCapture for the amazing work they did on my brother-in-law’s pre-wedding shoot. The team’s coordination and professionalism were excellent. We had opted for a complete package including costumes makeup, photography, and editing, all within the given budget and they delivered top-quality results. Truly happy with their work and highly recommend them.

Extremely happy with the video and photos. You guys rock !!!!!!!! Very very professional. The location has top notch aesthetics. Nature's Beauty with Cultural Elegance at its best. The team of makeup artist, saree draping, photographer and manager had helped us a lotttt in making our experience beautiful and lovely... Poetically speaking, you guys are artists, capturing happiness and love on reels and camera... Thanks again !!!!!!!

We had a great pre-wedding photoshoot experience with BookMyCapture. From start to finish, the entire team was professional, creative, and incredibly easy to work with. They made us feel completely at ease in front of the camera and that comfort is clearly reflected in the beautiful moments they captured.
Our photographer had a great eye for detail and suggested stunning locations and natural poses that matched our personalities perfectly. The editing was top-notch and the final images were delivered on time and exceeded our expectations. Each photo tells a story and we couldn't be happier with the memories we now have.
A heartfelt thanks to the incredibly talented makeup artists. Their skill, attention to detail and calming presence made the entire experience effortless and enjoyable. The makeup was flawless, enhancing our natural features while still looking elegant and timeless on camera. We truly felt our best and it shows in every photo. Thank you for being such an important part of our journey.

I had a wonderful experience with book my capture. This was our 2nd time there. The place is clean and beautiful. The manager is very calm and friendly. The atmosphere there is positive and very very comfortable for any kind of photoshoot. Highly recommend this place for toddler photoshoot, maternity photoshoot and pre wedding photoshoot. We will definitely be going back soon :-)

Cool and Quite place with collectios of many objectives for great photoshoot. They have multiple theme based background, objectives. I have booked photographer Kumar from site itself, He was great with camera, got many poses within few hrs 😀. Thanks Mr Girish for your support 👍.

I had my pre-wedding photoshoot at BookMyCapture, and it was an amazing experience! The place is absolutely beautiful with multiple stunning spots for pictures—truly a hub for photoshoots. It is also cost-effective, and you can choose your slot based on your convenience, making the process smooth and stress-free.

A special mention to Mr. Girish, who was very professional and helpful throughout. The location offers a variety of props, and the best part is that it’s not too crowded, which is perfect for shy couples who prefer a more private setting. You won’t feel uncomfortable with people staring while you pose.

The facility also has nice and clean changing rooms, and the overall cleanliness of the place is impressive. What truly won our hearts was that they happily allowed our pet, making the experience even more special.

A big thanks to the team at BookMyCapture for making our pre-wedding shoot so memorable. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a comfortable, picturesque, and well-managed photoshoot location!

A Gorgeous Victorian era colonial bungalow among tall trees and a gorgeous garden. Bungalow 7 is perfect if you’re looking for an out of the ordinary pre wedding shoot. Bungalow 7

reviews.reviewText: This place is fabulous for a crowd of 250 people! My husband and I hosted our engagement ceremony at Bungalow 7 and we were so in love with this place. The victorian styled bungalow and the surrounding courtyard gives you a rustic feel and is just what we needed for a intimate and romantic engagement. Anjali who owns Rings and Roses was the event planner and she was just perfect for us. She helped us plan our ONAM themed engagement with the perfect ambience and decor.The best part is each and every intricate detail is well planned and a lot of skill is put into it. Thank you Rings and Roses and Bungalow 7 for a surreal engagement party.If you love an intimate ceremony, this is the place to be!

Excellent place.. though I attended a trade Fair over here.. it is an excellent place for weddings and reception too.. lawn space is plenty.. you can decorate it as you want.. parking might be the only trouble.. as you just have to park on the road.. around the building.

Love at first sight!

One of my friends wedding party was conducted in Bungalow 7 the very first time itself we will love this place, i think the most beautiful time for the venue is evening, the vibe we got was really awesome

A very well maintained heritage building, a perfect venue for a function with more than 200 guest, surrounding are well maintained especially they have good washrooms

We won’t find any rush outside all though the place is situated in Bangalore

Decent location.. Spacious outdoors.. Ideal for outbound for corporates or even wedding occasions.. Food is catered by an external vendor n is OK. Extremely friendly n accommodative staff. We booked it for a corporate event n they patiently waited n went through entire vendor registration process n formalities.
It's an excellent venue for hosting a small function/event.

Beautiful venue for a wedding reception, seems like a heritage building. Good for 100-150 people, valet parking, kid friendly, clean restrooms . The only issue I would say was that the guests have to sit around the house so if you are having an event then some of the guests would be sitting a bit away from the area of the event. The house itself can be converted to a dance floor .

Venue is great but the people managing the property are not as friendly and have too many restrictions. They have an added layer of cost for whatever you need to get done. A good venue for large event but for smaller events like a baby shower or birthday it's not very cost effective.

This is an old bungalow in the Richards Town area, one of the few remaining. It's been turned into a function venue for up to about 150 guests. The property is well maintained and has a few large trees for shade/ atmosphere. Food can be catered in as needed. It is used for anything from a birthday party to a wedding.

ops.insert: Modern royal palace modeled on Windsor Castle offering tours, outdoor concerts & an amusement park.
Boating & walking in a peaceful, leafy spot, one of the largest lakes in Bangalore.
Established in 1870, this vibrant city park has walking paths, landscaped gardens & play areas.
Botanical garden with an aquarium & glasshouse designed to mimic London's former Crystal Palace.
Popular route teeming with crowds visiting the shops (fashion, accessories, tech) & eateries.
Man-made recreational lake featuring park benches, gazebos & a waterside promenade for pedestrians.
Museum housing paintings by modern & contemporary Indian artists, plus a cafe & an auditorium.
Ornate summer home of 18th century ruler Tipu Sultan offering scenic grounds & a historical exhibit.
Massive, architecturally notable building housing the state legislative chambers.
Upscale, modern rooftop bar with a vibrant scene offering global dishes & inventive cocktails.
Scenic lake with walking trails, recreation & picnic areas, also known for its vast bird population.
Urban, secondhand bookseller with a sizable collection of titles in fiction, cooking & other genres.
Primary city center street with traditional textile, jewelry & book traders & a missionary church.
Expansive, modern Hare Krishna temple campus, including shrines, food stalls & souvenir shops.
Amusement park with roller coasters, a ferris wheel & water rides, plus virtual reality experiences.
Three-level shopping center with luxury, international retailers, plus sophisticated restaurants.
Sleek, modern venue offering far-reaching views over the city, DJ music & a varied Asian menu.
Planetarium with shows in Kannada & English, plus a science center for educational activities.
Gothic-style Catholic church, consecrated in 1882, attracting crowds on St. Mary's Feast Day.
This lakeside park has colorful pedal boats for rent, plus a swimming pool & children's rides.

Butterfly park & tourism destination devoted to the preservation of approximately 70 species.

Open-air cafe in a garden, with colorful seating, a lively vibe & Continental food.

History museum displaying carvings, archeology & weaponry since 1877 in a historic red building.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Bengaluru, often referred to as the Garden City, is a vibrant blend of modernity and tradition, making it a photographer's dream. From the lush greenery of Cubbon Park to the serene waters of Ulsoor Lake, this city offers countless picturesque backdrops that capture its unique charm. Whether you're wandering through the historic Lalbagh Botanical Garden or exploring the artistic vibes at the National Gallery of Modern Art, each corner of Bengaluru tells a story waiting to be captured through your lens.

As you stroll through the bustling K.R Flower Market or admire the intricate architecture of St. Mary's Basilica, you'll find that Bengaluru is filled with hidden gems and well-known landmarks alike. The city's diverse landscapes, from tranquil lakes to majestic temples, provide endless opportunities for stunning photography. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the best photo spots that Bengaluru has to offer, where every snapshot is a chance to create lasting memories.

placeMetadata.name: Vidhana Soudha

sources.snippet: A brainchild of one Kengal Hanumanthaiah, Vidhana Soudha is arguably the epitome of palatial secretariats in India. Built in 1956, Vidhana Soudha boasts a marvelous blend of Neo-Dravidian and Indo-Saracenic architectural styles. After drawing eclectic inspiration from his travels across several continents, Hanumanthaiah gave Bangalore its symbol of identity in the form of this magnificent structure.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: The seat of Karnataka’s state legislature, Vidhana Soudha stands tall, marking itself as a landmark synonymous with Bangalore. Constructed in a neo-Dravidian style of architecture, the building brings together elements from different erstwhile kingdoms like Chalukya, Hoysala and Vijayanagara. A flight of stairs leading up to an entrance that welcomes you with imposing columns, a central dome topped with a structure similar to the country’s state emblem, watch towers…these are just some of what you see from the façade of this popular building.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

sources.snippet: Vidhana Soudha is one of the most symbolically significant buildings in the city, standing as the focal point of the legislative branch of Karnataka. Established in 1956, it is the largest building of its kind in the country - and the credit for its design goes to Kengal Hanumanthaiah. Taking much inspiration from his travels across the world, the structure blends Neo-Dravidian and Indo-Saracenic styles of architecture.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Historical Places In Bangalore, India - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: If you are setting out to explore historical places in Bangalore and its architectural gems, Vidhana Soudha deserves to be on top of your checklist. This magnificent structure designed in Neo-Dravidian style is the seat of the state legislature of Karnataka and was constructed in 1956. Elements from British, Indo-Islamic, and Dravidian architectures can be seen in the design.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Vidhana Soudha | #4 of 10 Best Historical Places in Bangalore. When we say history, it doesn’t necessarily have to be one that involves kings and queens and battles and palaces. How about visiting a place that has played an undeniable role in shaping the modern history of Karnataka?
sources.shortName: Top 10 Historical Places in Bangalore in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: Another example is the Vidhana Soudha, which is the seat of the state legislature of Karnataka. The building is designed in a way that reflects the traditional style of architecture in Bangalore. The building has a central dome that is surrounded by four smaller domes.
sources.shortName: Find the Top Architects in Bangalore to Bring Your Vision to Life

placeMetadata.description: Massive, architecturally notable building housing the state legislative chambers.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vidhana Soudha is a massive and architecturally significant building that houses the state legislative chambers in Bangalore, Karnataka. It is a landmark structure constructed in a neo-Dravidian style, incorporating elements from various historical kingdoms. The building features imposing columns, a central dome topped with a structure resembling the state emblem, and watchtowers. As the seat of the Government of Karnataka, Vidhana Soudha captivates visitors with its grand granite construction and impressive design.
placeMetadata.address: Dr Ambedkar Rd, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

reviews.reviewText: This impressive building completed in 1956 is the seat of the Karnataka Legislature in Bengaluru, India. It's over 500,000 square feet. It is one of the prominent examples of post-independence architecture in India, it stands as a landmark of Karnataka’s identity, architecture, and culture. The building was constructed from grey granite. Interior was designed to reflect dignity and grandeur while showcasing Indian cultural values. High-quality native woods were used extensively throughout.  Wear comfy shoes, take water, wear hat, sunscreen.  Popular with tourists.  Beautiful place. Lots to see. Parking is hard to find.  Great place for photography.

Vidhana Soudha is one of Bangalore’s most renowned landmarks, serving as the seat of the Karnataka State Legislature and Secretariat. As a symbol of Karnataka’s political and cultural legacy, it exudes elegance, especially when illuminated at night.

While general entry is restricted, visitors can still appreciate its architectural brilliance from the outside, except during select official events. Conveniently situated near Cubbon Park and the Karnataka High Court, it is easily reachable via Namma Metro (Vidhana Soudha station). The lush greenery and well-kept surroundings enhance its charm, making it an excellent spot for sightseeing and photography. Whether you’re a resident or a tourist, this iconic monument is an unmissable part of Bangalore’s heritage.

Starting from June 1, they open for guided tours. Unfortunately i wasn't able to view guided visit but had a chance to view in night. Seeing the building at night is a special feeling.
